Pum used her first loan, which she has repaid, to send her children to school and to provide her family with decent food. She now leads a three-person loan group, and she and one other member are requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR each while the third member is asking for 300,000 KHR. Pum will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava field so that she can grow a larger crop. She hopes that the cassava prices will rise soon so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava field.

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
To carry on the business and increase revenue, the Tunjung Wiguna group continued the loans. With the same loan amounts, their use will still be to buy piglets and feed.
In this loan period, Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy four piglets of a local species. Pigs are sold every 3 months. With this method, she hopes can turn over the money more quickly and take maximum profits. All profits will be saved for use as working capital. Ni Ketut has a dream to repair the kitchen from the profits of this business.

loans.use: To buy four piglets of a local species

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to help her relatives through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma.martina

texts.en:
This is Ma. Martina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her computers. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her computers. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Martina hopes to add more computers to her shop and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mat is 43 years old and married to a resident of Kampot province. They live together with their three single children there. Mat and her husband help each other in their farm work, growing and harvesting rice annually. Mat’s profit seems not enough to cover her daily expenses, so she sometimes has financial constrains in living. Mat discussed with her husband regarding a way to upgrade their standard of living. As a result, they aim to handle an animal trading business by purchasing cows from the local area and then trading to another. 

Due to the lack of capital to invest in their new business (animal trading), Mat decided to take out a loan from Kiva and HKL to purchase cows for trading purpose. Through this business, Mat hopes that she will be able to improve her household income, which will be used to satisfy their living needs and their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cows for trading purposes.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell. She has earned a living by buying and selling livestock for the last year and earns  additional income from the sale of vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Wuibatin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WUIBATIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Christine est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Désiré. Christine a peu fréquenté l’école. Christine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Christine vit seule avec ses enfants. Les divers besoins du ménage sont assurés par le couple. Pour contribuer à ses différents besoins, Christine vend depuis onze ans, divers produits (amuses gueules, conserves) dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WUIBATIN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Wuibatin group is composed of three people living in the same house. It is the fourth time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Christine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Christine is 41 years old. Her husband’s name is Désiré. Christine has had little school education. She is the mother of two children, both in in school and in her care. Christine lives  with her children. The spouses provide for various family needs. In order to meet her expenses, for 11 years Christine has been selling miscellaneous items (snacks, canned food) in her neighborhood. This business allows her to provide for her needs without great difficulty. Christine stocks up at a market of Benin as well as in her region. With the goal of satisfying customer expectations and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Christine, together with the other members of the Wuibatin group, is seeking her fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow the group members to expand their businesses, growing their customer base and their revenues. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items (snacks, canned food).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, dress shirts, blouses and dresses

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
This is Edmun, who previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that he used for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His additional earnings have been a big help toward the education of his children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Edmun is requesting a new loan for 9,000 PHP to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and meet the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edmun hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en: To increase their businesses, members of the Nyuh Gading group have continued to borrow loans of increasing size from MUK. They feel comfortable with these loans because they have also been trained by the MUK staff. After the success of her last loan, Kadek is taking a new loan to purchase a sow. The price for a sow is 1,5M IDR. All the profit from this business will be saved. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful breeder of pigs and seller of piglets.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, a hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling vegetables in the Philippines for five years, also earns income from food vending. Jocelyn, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 15000 to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.  She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell for her general store.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita, a 57-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for six years and earns additional income from selling rice.

Nelita has borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting one for PHP 25000 to buy more stocks to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Emelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is 26 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Sarah Jane is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional cow to raise.

Sarah Jane has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 52 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Zosima is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Zosima has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from banana retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 64 years old and married with eight children.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Belinda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food and vegetable vending.

Belinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Fe has been in this business for 12 years. Fe earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a 43 year old married man from Bohol, Philippines.  He has four children, ages 19, 16, 14 and 12 years old. Cirilo has been in the transportation business using a tricycle to carry passengers from one place to another. This business provides him the income that he needs for the family.
As of now, Cirilo is in need of additional capital for his business. He is applying for a loan  worth 10,000PHP to buy fuel and to maintain the tricycle. With this, Cirilo will be able to transport more passengers, thus giving him more chance of increasing his income. 

Cirilo dreams of making his business grow and become more sustainable. Moreover, he wants to augment his income so that he will be able to send his children to school for better learning and education. He wants to experience fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy fuel, and to maintain the tricycle

loans.name: Maria Virgilia

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar en su producción de hamácas y de cortinas, se ha decidido por este préstamo pues considera que es necesario la compra de hilos de seda de diferentes colores, y también pagará mano de obra para que le ayude a elaborar las hamacas ya que tiene algunos pedidos.

El préstamo anterior le permitió realizar una buena producción de hamacas, atendiendo los pedidos que le habían realizado algunos clientes, se compró suficiente material y  ha logrado conseguir un crecimiento de nuevos clientes y ha podido proveer el alimento a su familia.
texts.en:
María requests a new loan to continue manufacturing hammocks and drapes.  She’s decided on this loan because she believes it’s necessary to buy silk thread in assorted colors and will also pay labor costs for a helper to make hammocks since she has pending orders.

The previous loan allowed her to have a good production of hammocks and to fill some customer orders she had.  She bought enough material and has increased the number of her new customers; she’s been able to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy silk thead and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ma.  Charito

texts.en:
Ma. Charito is 36 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Charito works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Charito has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running a charcoal retail business for 16 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and selling root crops.

Ma. Charito aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Loek

texts.en:
Loek happily lives at Kampot province with her husband and four single children, while her oldest child lives separately with her new family. To make a living, Loek owns and manages a few plots of land for growing rice annually. 

Loek also has a mango plantation, from which she can harvest fruits for sale every year. This will be added to her main income from farming, so as to elevate her living conditions. 

Loek would like to maintain fruitful mangoes, so she is borrowing a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase pesticides for spraying the mangoes. 

Loek hopes to keep growing her business and make a consistent income for her family. She is very thankful for the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides for spraying mangoes.

loans.name: Lonlongnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LONLONGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mélanie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mélanie est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Nicové. Mélanie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mélanie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Mélanie vend de la nourriture (haricot préparé) de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Mélanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mélanie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LONLONGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group LONLONGNON comprises three persons who are friends. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Mélanie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 46 years old and married to a man named Nicové. Mélanie did not attend school. The couple have three children, not all in school but in their care. Mélanie lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the different household expenses.

To help with different family needs, Mélanie has been selling food (cooked beans) from place to place. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Mélanie, along with the other members of the group LONLONGNON, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy beans and oil

loans.name: Wilbert Alberto

texts.es:
Wilbert, necesita un nuevo préstamo y esto es debido a que inicia la nueva siembra de la temporada de verano, en la cual está sembrando nuevamente maíz para ello necesita comprarse siete sacos de abono, y también herbicidas, a través de estos materiales espera continuar mejorando su producción en el cultivo.

El préstamo anterior le permitió un aumento en la producción de la cosecha, logró comercializarla y tener ganancias para sus gastos, en este periodo ha sido nuevamente padre, contando con un pequeñín quien también dependerá de sus ingresos, espera que través de su trabajo su crecimiento económico sea más próspero.
texts.en:
Wilbert needs a new loan because he’s starting the new summer season planting.  He is once again planting corn and to do so needs seven sacks of manure and also herbicide.  These supplies will make it possible for him to continue improving crop yields.

His previous loan allowed him to increase crop yields.  He sold it and earned profits to cover his expenses.  He’s become a father again during this period; he now has a little boy that will also depend on his income.  He hopes that his economic growth will be more prosperous by means of his work.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of manure and to buy herbicide.

loans.name: Sonia Roxana

texts.es:
Sonia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues su intención es mantenerse trabajando, con estos fondos prestados invertirá en la compra de blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, que son necesarios para poder continuar buscando las oportunidades de crecimiento económico en el mercado.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar un aumento en la mercadería y también ha logrado que su clientela tengan mejores opciones de compra, esto le ha permitido a ella tener mejores ganancias, gracias a estos créditos del proyecto kiva, su situación económica está mejorando junto a Su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided on a new loan because her intention is to keep working.  With these loans she’ll buy blouses, pants and underwear needed to continue seeking economic growth opportunities in the marketplace.
She attained an increase in merchandise with the previous loan and also was able to offer her customers a wider selection of goods which led to higher profits, all thanks to loans from Kiva.  Her economic and family situation is improving.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
In order to further enhance earnings in the field of breeding pigs, Ni Ketut and the whole group of Kerto Sato continue borrowing from MUK with the same amount. They are very satisfied with the services provided, so they agreed to develop this business. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy three super-quality piglets for later sale. The price remains high. She still expects the assistance of MUK for business consulting. Profits will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to buy three super-quality piglets.

loans.name: Mahoulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOULOME est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bernadette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bernadette est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différentes charges, Bernadette vend des céréales (maïs, riz), des conserves et des condiments à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Bernadette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOME, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHOULOME comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Bernadette, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and married to a man named Didier. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their care. Bernadette lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the different household expenses.

To help with the different expenses, Bernadette has been selling grains (corn, rice), canned foods, and condiments out of her home. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Bernadette, along with the other members of the group MAHOULOME, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy grains (corn, rice), canned foods, and condiments

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El  Sr. Jose tiene 30 es soltero, el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Porvenir,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Jose va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de sandia y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  el Sr. Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara su  calidad de vida  ya que el se mantiene con esta actividad, El Sr.  Jose es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: José, 30, is single.  He works in agriculture growing a variety of vegetables like potatoes and manioc on his parcel located in the community of Porvenir.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and José will use it for his watermelon crop and everything related to preparing the soil.  His reason for requesting the loan is to have the resources needed for the planting and to be able to subsist.  The business challenge José faces is severe weather which sometimes ruins crops.  He will use profits to improve his quality of life since he supports himself by means of this activity.  José is a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra.  Angela  tiene 63 años con nueve que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una de las calles Más concurridas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una empleada quien le ayuda a preparar y también atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de insumos (papa, arroz, fideo y otros) para lograr tener una despensa llena,  la Sra. Angela es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Ángela, 63, has nine children who are all independent now.  She sells food, an activity she carries out daily in her food stand located on one of the city of Santa Cruz’s busiest streets; she prepares and sells varied dishes to her customers.  This activity is her main source of income for her and her family.  She has an employee that helps her cook and serve.  The loan is to buy larger amounts of ingredients and supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles and others) to have a full pantry.  Ángela is a very hardworking person who has been selling food for years; she’s very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Jose Arquimides

texts.es:
José, solicita un préstamo pues está iniciando nuevamente cultivo de granos básicos y para esto necesita los materiales que le previenen las plagas y le fortalece la producción, su compra será en ocho sacos de abono, dentro de ellos irán cuatro de fórmula y cuatro de sulfato, también comprará herbicidas.

El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar la producción en la cosecha, teniendo una mejor capacidad para trabajar, su familia considera que se mantiene con su situación económica, han aumentado en un miembro más, está agradecido por estos financiamientos que le permite ofrecerle una mejor situación a ellos.
texts.en:
José requests a loan because he’s once again starting to plant basic grains and needs supplies to prevent infestations and that strengthen production.  He will buy 8 sacks of manure among which will be four of formula and four of sulfate; he’ll also buy herbicide.

He states that the previous loan helped him to improve crop yield being able to work more.  He feels that his family is maintaining their economic situation and it’s grown by one more members.  He’s grateful for the loans that help him provide a better situation for them.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con su esposo y un hijo, solamente el hijo depende de sus ingresos, el negocio no aprendió con su madre que se ha dedicado a lo mismo, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene horario establecido ya que depende de la demanda.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de ropa en blusas, faldas y ropa interior, esto le permitirá aumentar la disponibilidad de nuevas prendas en el negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes, dándose la oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas.

El objetivo de Ana es el futuro poder mejorar su condición económica con su hijo, fortalecer el negocio y comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Ana sells clothes.  She lives with her husband and son; only her son depends on her income.  She learned the business from her mother who was in the same occupation.  She works selling from place to place and does not have a fixed schedule since it depends on demand.

She’s asking for a loan to buy a variety of clothes consisting in blouses, skirts and underwear.  This will make it possible for her to increase availability of new items in the business to offer her customers increasing her opportunities to improve sales.  Ana’s future goal is to improve her economic situation with her son, to strengthen her business and to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Abdusabur

texts.ru: Абдусабур житель города Исфара. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Абдусабура портниха. Сам Абдусабур более десяти лет занимается купле - продажей сухофруктов. Он реализует товар у себя дома. Абдусабур просит кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Abdusabur is a resident of Isfara. He is 41 years old, married and has three children. Abdusadur's wife is a seamstress and Abdusadur himself has been selling dried fruit for ten years. He sells the produce from his home. Abdusadur is requesting this loan to increase his inventory turnover.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit for whole sale

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru:
Убайдулло родился 1984 году. Он проживает в районе Яван. Убайдулло женат. Он является любящим отцом четверых детей. Убайдулло живет с родителями. Его отец находится за рубежом. 
Убайдулло трудолюбивый и добрый человек. На протяжении четырех лет он зарабатывает путем разведения крупного рогатого скота. Убайдулло разводит скот у себя дома. Он просит кредит для закупа телят и бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Ubaydullo was born in 1984. He lives in Yavan region of Tajikistan. Ubaydullo is married and a loving father of four children. The family lives together with Ubaydullo's parents and his father is away working abroad. Ubaydullo is a kind and hard working man. For the last four year he has been making a living by raising cattle. He keeps a small herd in the barn by his house. Ubaydullo is requesting a loan to purchase calves and a steer so that he can expand his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves and a steer

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells salted fish and cooking ingredients in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, Ghana.  She is married and has seven children.  Her husband is a mason.  Ekua has been selling salted fish and cooking ingredients for three years now.  She is responsible for paying school fees.  Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and cooking ingredients in bulk.  She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and cooking ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Condokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CONDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Valérie Eléonor est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Valérie Eléonor est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Valérie Eléonor est mère de deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à la charge du couple. Valérie Eléonor vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Valérie Eléonor vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des céréales dans un quartier son Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses charges. Valérie Eléonor s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Valérie Eléonor sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CONDOKPO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group CONDOKPO comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Valérie Eléonor, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 42 years old and married to a man named Jean. She is the mother of two children, of whom one is in school, and both are in the care of the couple. She lives together with  her husband and children, and along with her husband, she ensures that the diverse household needs are met. 

To help with different household needs, Valérie Eléonor has been selling grains in her district in Benin for about ten years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Valérie Eléono, along with the other members of the group CONDOKPO, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Celestial Group

texts.en:
The Celestial Trust Bank is located in the Pasach First Village in Cantel Quetzaltenango, northwest of Guatemala City. The Trust Bank is comprised of nine women who work hard every day, seeking better lives for themselves and their families. The businesses that these women are engaged in include making and selling typical clothing, wholesale sandals and embroidery, tailoring, and operating convenience stores.

49-year old Felisa is taking her fifth loan. Felisa never attended school.  She has eight children (six boys and two girls) with her husband, who works as a day laborer. Felisa's business is both hand embroidery and machine embroidery, techniques that Felisa began learning from her family as a child. With her previous loans, Felisa has been able to buy three sewing machines for herself, her daughter in-law, and one of her sons. The three of them have started a small business, which has been a blessing for them because it generates income for all three of their families. Felisa is very satisfied with her efforts, as the profits from her business have ensured that her eldest children can remain in school through high school. 

Felisa is happy to be taking a new loan with Friendship Bridge, as the new loan will help her to buy yarn and fabric in large quantities to meet the demand of three new potential clients. To sell the maximum amount of her products, Felisa regularly travels to another market, which is a huge handicraft market and the largest indigenous marketplace in Central America located about three hours away from her home.
 
Felisa is an active participant in Trust Bank loan repayment meetings and appreciates the informal education lessons delivered by Friendship Bridge each month.  Felisa and the other women in the Celestial Trust Bank are able to share and comment on educational lessons ranging from business practices and money management to self-esteem, women’s rights, health and how to support their children’s education. These lessons not only provide the women with valuable information regarding their businesses and their families’ health but also foster a community of support among the women.

loans.use: To buy yarn and fabric in large quantities.

loans.name: Hilda Mabel

texts.es:
Hilda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para poder realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas, se comprara el maíz que es el principal y también la leña, estos materiales son los que se utilizan a diario para qué ella pueda continuar con sus ventas de tortillas, el préstamo ayudara a que realice una compra por mayor cantidad y asi mismo puedan los proveedores darle un mejor precio.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar sus ventas de tamales y la sastrería, ella realiza cualquier tipo de negocio que pueda generarle un margen de ganancia, ya que actualmente los negocios son variantes y por lo mismo se dedica en algunas ocasiones a elaborar tamales así como las tortillas.
texts.en:
Hilda has decided on a new loan in order to be able to buy raw materials to make tortillas.  She will buy corn, which is the main thing.  She will also buy firewood.  These are the materials used every day so that she will be able to continue with her tortilla sales.  The loan will help her buy a larger quantity, and the providers will be able to give her a better price.

With the previous loan she managed to improve her tamale sales and her dressmaking business.  She does whatever type of business that can generate a profit margin.  Her businesses now vary.  Sometimes she makes as many tamales as tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery tiene 31 años casada ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  Que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de 23 de Noviembre,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Rosmery utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes por mayor como arroz y azúcar,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Rosmery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería surtida. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y de esta manera tener más clientes y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos
texts.en: Rosmery, 31, is married and works selling basic staple items in her neighborhood store located in the 23 de Noviembre zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Rosmery will use it to buy sock merchandise like rice and sugar at wholesale.  The reason for requesting the loan is that she needs to stock her store.  The business challenge Rosmery faces is the local economy’s fluctuations.  She will use her profits to continue buying assorted merchandise.  Her wish for her business is that it become larger and better stocked so that she will have more customers and improved income as a result.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Neicy

texts.es: La Sra. Neicy tiene 28 años tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 12, 7 y 5 años, ella se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Rio Seco este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Neicy  va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de tomate compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  la Sra. Neicy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida su familia ya que ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar, la Sra. Neicy es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Neicy, 28, has three children whose ages are 12, 7 and 5 years.  She works in agriculture growing a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes and manioc on her land located in the community of Río Seco.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Neicy will use it for her tomato crop and to buy corn seeds and also for everything related to soil preparation.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to have resources to be able to plant and to be able to subsist.  The business challenge Neicy faces is severe weather which often damages crops.  She will use profits to improve her family’s quality of life since she’s responsible for all household expenses.  Neicy is a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Davlatsho

texts.ru: Давлатшо молодой мужчина 35 лет, женат, отец 3 детей. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2010 года. На рынке он работает почти 3 года, торгуя различными тканями для пошива женской одежды. Сейчас у него начинается летний сезон продаж тканей, и торговля идет хорошо. Поэтому она планирует на полученный кредит привезти широкий ассортимент товара. Его занятие является основным доходом для семьи, так как его жена нигде не работает и занимается домашним хозяйством и воспитанием  детей. Давлатшо выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Davlatsho is a youthful 35 year old man. He is married and a father of three children. Davlatsho has been working with our organization since 2010. For three years Davlatsho has been selling fabrics for women's clothes at the local market. The summer season for selling fabrics has began and the business is good. Davlatsho is planning to use the loan to purchase additional summer fabrics for sale in his store and expand his inventory. His retail work is the main source of income for the family as his wife is a home maker and takes care of the children. Davlatsho is very grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Сафармо проживает в городе Дангара. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем. Сафармо живет с мужем. Дочь Сафармо является студенткой. 
Сафармо имеет среднее образование. Она занимается животноводством. Сафармо разводит скот у себя дома. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Животноводством Сафармо занимается 7 лет. 
Сафармо просит кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Safarmo lives in Dangara. She is 55 years old, married and lives with her husband. Safarmo's daughter is a college student. Safarmo herself has a high school degree and raises animals for a living in her home plot. She fattens the cattle for further resale at the market. Safarmo has been raising cattle for seven years and is taking out this loan to purchase more calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.ru:
Сохибназар 49 - летний женатый мужчина, проживающий в городе Дангара. У него четверо детей. Старший сын Сохибназара находится на заработках в России, а старшая дочь занимается домашним хозяйством. Двое других учатся в средней школе. 
Сохибназар имеет средне - специальное образование, он повар по специальности. Сохибназар пятнадцать лет проработал поваром в национальной кухне. 
Уже четыре года как Сохибназар занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Сохибназар берет кредит для закупа крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Sohibnazar is a 49 year old man who lives in Dangara. He has four children. His eldest son is working in Russia and his eldest daughter takes care of the household. The two younger children are still attending school. Sohibnazar has a professional degree as a chef. He has been working as a chef at a Tajik cafe for fifteen years. For the last four years Sohibnazar has been raising cattle at home. He is taking out this loan to purchase more calves for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene 26 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 4 y 2 años,  ella se dedica  a la  venta y  crianza de cerdos en la zona de Chimboco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Esperanza va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra alimento balanceado para cerdos, la Sra. Esperanza enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Esperanza, 26, has two children whose ages are 4 and 2.  She raises and sells pigs in Chimboco.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Esperanza will use it to buy pigs for her business.  The reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital needed to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pigs.  The business challenge Esperanza faces is improving her quality of life.  She will use profits to improve her pigs’ nutrition.  Her wish is to have a farm where she can raise a large number of pigs thus improving her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: El-Shaddaï Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EL-SHADDAÏ est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies pratiquant les mêmes activités. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Roberte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Roberte est âgée de 46 ans et est une veuve. Roberte a peu fréquenté l’école. Roberte est mère de deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous deux à sa charge. Roberte vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses divers besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants. Pour parvenir aux différents besoins de la maison, Roberte vend des plastiques et du maïs par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Roberte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Roberte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EL-SHADDAÏ, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group  EL-SHADDAÏ comprises four persons who are friends having the same businesses. The group's representative, Roberte, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 46 years old and a widow. Roberte has had little schooling. She is the mother of two children, of whom one is in school and both are in her care. She lives alone with her children and ensures by herself that her diverse needs and those of her children are met. 

To help with different household needs, Roberte has been selling plasticware and corn via the distribution system. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Roberte, along with the other members of the group  EL-SHADDAÏ, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The first three loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Noussiratou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Noussiratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Noussiratou est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Souleman. Noussiratou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noussiratou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Noussiratou vend des chaussures et des sachets à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Noussiratou s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Noussiratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Noussiratou, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 35 years old and married to a man named Souleman. Noussiratou left primary school. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. She lives together with  her husband and children. The couple share in covering the different household expenses.

To help with different household needs, Noussiratou has been selling shoes and pouches out of her home. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from Nigeria. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Noussiratou, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy shoes and pouches to sell

loans.name: Diana Auxiliadora

texts.es: Diana mantiene su negocio de venta de ropa el cual inicio hace varios años. Empezó por la necesidad de querer ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ahora no podría dejar su negocio ya que esta enseñada a manejar su propio dinero. La venta la realiza todos los días en horas de la tarde recorriendo las calles realizando ventas de puerta a puerta persona por persona, enseñando sus productos para cerrar la venta. Como su esposo es panificador y su hijo estudia en la guardería tiene el tiempo necesario para dedicarle al negocio. Con el crédito que está solicitando comprara ropa de hombre, mujer y niño para la venta esperando que aumenten para pagar sin problemas las cuotas. A futuro le gustaría expandir su negocio con lo que tendría mas clientes.
texts.en: Diana still has her clothing sales business she started several years ago.  She started out because she needed to help her husband cover household expenses.  Now, she couldn’t leave her business because she’s learned how to manage her own money.  She sells every day during the afternoon going from door to door and from person to person in the street displaying her goods to clinch the sale.  Since her husband is a baker and her son attends day-care she has time available for her business.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy clothes for men, women and children to sell hoping her sales will increase so that she can repay the loan problem-free.  In the future she’d like to expand the business so that she can have more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mawu Wegni Daho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWU WEGNI DAHO est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elise est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Isaac. Elise est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Elise vend depuis une trentaine d’année, des fagots de bois, de l’huile végétale et des fruits dans un quartier son Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Elise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Elise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWU WEGNI DAHO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAWU WEGNI DAHO comprises five persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Elise, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 41 years old and married to a man named Isaac. She is the mother of three children, all in school and in the couple's care. Elise lives together with her husband and children, and along with her husband, she ensures that the diverse household needs are met. 

To help with different household needs, Elise has been selling bundles of wood, vegetable oil, and fruit in her district for about thirty years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Elise, along with the other members of the group MAWU WEGNI DAHO, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The first two loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy containers of vegetable oil and some fruit

loans.name: Daysi Pamela

texts.es:
Daysi es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 2 pequeños hijos a quienes ama y son razón principal en la vida, a pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Secretariado que tanto deseaba, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Juanes (plato típico de su ciudad) para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, día a día Daysi puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, tales como: cecina, chorizo, tacaco y otros potajes típicos de su ciudad, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 20 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por su buena sazón y por su trato amble.
Daysi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos, tales como: arroz, azúcar, carne de cerdo, condimentos, hojas de bijao, entre otros; de esta manera Daysi contará con los insumos necesarios para preparar sus deliciosos potajes, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para que en un futuro no muy para asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Daysi is a 23-year-old woman living in the city of Pucallpa with her two small children she loves and who are her reason for living.  Despite her young age, she’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to get ahead.  Because she needed to start working to help her parents and cover her own expenses, she was unfortunately unable to study the secretarial career she so wanted to but dreams with being able to do so someday.  In her free time she enjoys taking walks along the warm streets of her city and sometimes cooks some delicious “Juanes” (typical dish of her city) to share with her family.

With much dedication and thanks to her mother’s teachings, Daysi set up her small food selling business.  She sells such things as:  ‘cecina’ [dried, cured meat], chorizo, ‘tacacho’ [smoked, salted pork with mashed plantain] and other dishes typical of her city.  She spends about 10 hours daily in her business and can tend to up to 20 customers.  She feels good doing her work and believes that she does well because her customers seek her out due to her tasty preparations and her kind treatment.

Daysi is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy supplies like rice, sugar, pork, condiments and bijao leaves, among others.  In this way, Daysi will have the necessary ingredients on hand to prepare her delicious dishes.  With this she hopes to increase sales and income that she want so use so that in the not too distant future she will be able to insure her little ones’ schooling and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Santíago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él es un hombre con muchos deseos de trabajar, tiene 30 años de experiencia en trabajos agrícolas; en la cría de ganado y cerdos. Santiago aprendió junto con sus hermanos, debido a que desde pequeños crecieron trabajando como jornaleros en los cultivos de algodón en una hacienda. Posteriormente, identificaron que les era más rentable realizar sus propios trabajos y desde entonces se dedicaron a trabajar en la agricultura para ellos mismos.

Para comprar los animales don Santiago tiene que viajar a un tiangue en camión, que tarda en llegar cuarenta y cinco minutos y otros cuarenta y cinco minutos de regreso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillos para engordarlos en repasto y para comprar cerdos pequeños engordarlos en pequeños chiqueros en su casa. Debido a la sequía que esta afectando el país don Santiago desgraciadamente perdió 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, por esa razón desea comprar cerdos y ganado para buscar otra fuente de ingresos. Por lo que el préstamo ayudara en mucho, en la obtención de ingresos más seguros producto de la venta de sus animales. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, pues le hacen falta varias cosas que hacer.
texts.en:
Santiago, 59, is married and has two children.  He’s a man who very much wants to work. He has 30 years’ experience in agricultural work; he raises cattle and pigs.  Santiago learned alongside his brothers because they grew up working as day laborers on a cotton plantation.  Later on they realized that it would be more profitable to work for themselves and since then have been working in agriculture doing their own work.  In order to buy animals, Santiago has to go to a street market and the trip takes forty five minutes each way.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two calves to fatten up in the pasture and to buy piglets to fatten up in the pigsties he has at home.  Because draught has been affecting the country, Santiago lost 7,000 square meters of corn unfortunately and this is why he wants to buy pigs and cattle to find an alternative source of income.  The loan will help him much to earn more secure income through his animal sales.  His dream is to finish building his house because he still has several things left to do.

loans.use: to buy calves and piglets.

loans.name: Fidelicia

texts.es:
La señora Fidelicia tiene 52 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, oficio que aprendió de su mamá desde que era una niña. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno a sus hijos y alistarlos para llevarlos a la escuela. Luego, sale a las 6:30 a.m. a visitar los diferentes lugares aledaños al lugar donde ella vive debido a que ella lo hace a pie caminando.  Para comprar la mercadería, Fidelicia viaja a la capital del país, ya que considera que ahí los adquiere a mejor precio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más cantidad de mercadería a fin de surtir su negocio para satisfacer a sus clientes, pues esta abarcando más lugares y el número de clientes se está incrementando. Con lo que espera incrementar sus ingresos, para continuar enviando sus hijos a la escuela y un día enviarlos a que estudien bachillerato proporcionándoles todo lo que necesitan. Ella desea adquirir un medio de trasporte, pues considera que ha su edad ya se le dificulta andar vendiendo a pie caminando por varios lugares.
texts.en:
Fidelicia, 52, has two children.  She sells clothes, an occupation she learned from her mother when she was a little girl.  She rises at 4am to prepare her children’s breakfast and get them ready for school.  Then, at 6am she heads out to visit the various places around her neighborhood since she does it on foot.  To buy merchandise, Fidelicia travels to the nation’s capital because she believes she gets better prices there.

The loan she’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy more merchandise to stock her business and meet customer demand because she’s going to more places and the number of her customers has increased.  She hopes to increase her income to continue sending her children to school and one day send them to high school and give them everything they need.  She wants to acquire a mode of transportation because she feels that at her age selling from place to place on foot is difficult.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ermek

texts.en: Ermek is 42 years old and lives with his wife and his five children in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife helps his business and his children go to the secondary school. He conducted a retail trade business in 2010 - 2012. He started a clothes trade business a short time ago, but he is lacking working capital, so he needs 600,000 MNT to purchase the goods for his clothes trade business. He is planning to expand his clothes trade business. He said, "I want to increase the profit and to save money for my five children's higher education." He is an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase the goods for his clothes trade business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy auto repair tools and spare parts for her husband's auto-repairing business

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es:
Maria es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de nazca, Nazca es una ciudad cuyos pobladores son muy generosos y hospitalarios, tiene un legado en cuanto a cultura, como peruanos estamos muy orgullosos de esta ciudad ya que alberga las líneas de nazca, estas han sido dibujadas en un extenso campo y que eran utilizadas por la cultura Nazca para la agricultura ya que eran una especie de calendario en donde ellos podían saber cuando era la época de lluvia, debido a estas majestuosas líneas esta ciudad alberga cada año infinidad de turistas. Maria es madre de un pequeño d e1 año de edad, a quien ama muchísimo y sobre todo porque es su razón de vivir y también porque es el regalo más grande que Dios le ha dado; cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, pero sobre todo compartir un tiempo junto a  su pequeño y en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”. Debido a su pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, entre otros; ella trabaja alrededor de 7 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día. Ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, como perfumes, cmaquillaje, cremas, shampoos, acondicionadores, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá mas productos para ofrecer y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who lives in the town of Nazca. The local people are very generous, hospitable, and there is a strong local culture. Peruvians are very proud of the town as the Nazca lines are located there. The lines cover a huge area and were used by people from the Nazca culture for agriculture as they form a kind of calendar indicating the rainy season. Because of these majestic lines the town welcomes a large influx of tourists every year.

Maria is mother to a one-year old whom she loves very much. He is her raisin d'être and the greatest gift God has given her. In her free time Maria likes to watch television, but most of all she likes to spend time with her son. Now and again she likes to eat one of favorite dishes, the delicious 'lomo saltado' (stir-fried beef with fried potatoes). Because she is from a poor family, Maria only has a high school education, but she would have liked to go to university.

Every day Maria goes to work selling beauty products such as perfume, lotions, and make up. She works about seven hours a day, and might have up to ten customers in that time. She believes that the business is doing well because she is friendly to her customers, but most of all because she is keen to get ahead.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva donors--thanks to their great help she will be able to buy more merchandise such as perfume, make up, lotions, shampoo, and conditioner. She will have more products to offer her customers so she will be able to earn more money, allowing her to work hard and realise her dream of owning her own house.

loans.use: Buy more beauty products

loans.name: Carmen De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Carmen tiene 49 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su mamá desde que era una niña y el cual ejerce junto a sus hijos. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno a sus hijos y luego se va a dejar sus animales al terreno que esta a unos tres kilómetros de su casa. Una vez llega a su casa alimenta a sus cerdos y posteriormente se traslada junto a sus hijos a trabajar en la milpa. Los insumos agrícolas y el alimento para sus animales los adquiere en una ciudad, para llegar ahí aborda un autobús que tarda una hora en llegar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras y si le alcanza comprara tres. Con el objetivo de obtener mas leche e ingresos que le permitan mantener a su familia. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda que esta elaborada de ladrillo, pero el techo es de lámina y desea cambiarlo ya que tiene muchas goteras.
texts.en:
Carmen, 49, has four children.  She works in agriculture, an occupation she learned from her mother when she was a little girl and that she carries out alongside her children.  She rises at 4am to prepare her children’s breakfast and then she heads out to leave her animals on a piece of land located about three kilometers from home.  Once she returns home she feeds the pigs and then heads out with her children to work in the corn fields.  She buys the farm supplies and animal feed in a city and to get there she takes a bus ride that takes an hour to get there.

The loan she’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two dairy cows and if she can afford it she’ll buy three.  The objective is to obtain more milk and income that will make it possible for her to support her family.  Her dream is to improve her house that’s brick but the roof is metal sheeting and she’d like to replace it because it has many leaks.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Dalia Daniela

texts.es: Dalia a sus 50 años de edad continua soltera y sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Ella tiene en su casa una venta de productos naturales la cual empezó debido a su situación económica ya que se vio obligada realizar una actividad comercial, se decidió por estos productos porque le permite tener tiempo con su familia. Los productos Dalia los vende recorriendo diversos sectores de la ciudad trabajando sola de lunes a viernes. Su forma de trabajar es llevando muestras del producto y mostrando los catálogos para que pueden elegir y solicitar los productos y hacer el pedido. Con el crédito espera comprar productos para tener en stock como vitaminas, adelgazantes, endulzantes etc., a futuro espera poder tener un negocio más grande en un lugar comercial.
texts.en: Dalia is 50 and single; her children are adults and independent. She sells natural products from her house, a business she started because of her financial situation and because it allowed her to spend time with her family. Dalia travels alone from Monday to Friday selling her products in different sections of the city. She carries samples and catalogs from which her customers can ask about, choose, and order the items they wish. She will use the loan to buy products such as vitamins, weight loss items, and sweeteners. She hopes to have a bigger business in a commercial space in the future.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, weight loss porducts, and sweeteners.

loans.name: Nematullohoja

texts.en:
Nematullohoja is married to a lovely woman named Kutfiniso. They have three children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that five years ago, he began his own business with driving. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. 

Since Nematullohoja has had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, now that his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. Nematullohoja is asking for a loan to repair his car. He is going to buy new covers for the interior of his taxi. 

In this way his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which allows him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair car used as taxi

loans.name: Tumate

texts.en:
Tumate is 23 years old. He is single and has been in the animal-sales business for seven years. He earns an income of KES 15,000.

This is his first KADET LTD loan, which he will use to purchase more animals to sell. His dream is to expand his business. With the profit he makes, he will use to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Dorotea Hermelinda

texts.es:
Dorotea es una mujer 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, ella tiene 4 hijas a quienes ama y son su razón principal en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijas; Dorotea es una persona luchadora, alegre, entusiasta y muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace un año Dorotea puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, tales como arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros; ella siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora, anteriormente trabajo como obrera en fundos de su ciudad y adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en algunas casas cercanas a su hogar; ella se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Dorotea se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de 2 andamios y una vitrina mostrador; de esta manera Dorotea tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá exhibir adecuadamente sus productos, así ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda cumplir su gran sueño de tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Dorotea is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial. She has four daughters whom she loves, and they are her main reason to live. Unfortunately, due to several circumstances, her and her partner separated several years ago. She has been a mother and a father to her daughters ever since. Dorotea is a fighter and a hard worker. She is cheerful, enthusiastic, and puts all of her effort into providing for her family.

Full of dedication and enthusiasm, Dorotea started her small business a year ago, selling groceries such as rice, sugar, sodas, sweets, and other items. She has always been a hard worker. Previously she worked as a farm laborer in her area, and she also works on weekends providing cleaning services to several houses near her home. She enjoys working and believes things are going well because she is dedicated to her work and treats others kindly.

Dorotea is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help provided she will be able to purchase two shelving units and a display counter. This will allow Dorotea to have a better-equipped business and she will be able to display her products adequately. She hopes this will increase her sales and improve her financial income, which will be of great help for her to make her greatest dream come true, which is opening her own restaurant some day in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two shelving units and a display counter.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is 36 years old. She is a hard-working woman who always tries to find new ways of earning income. Her partner is also a kind and industrious man. They have two children, and they love them very much.  They live happily but poorly because their income from making canned goods is not enough to improve their living conditions. 

Mavluda makes tinned goods out of fruits and vegetables at her house. She began working this way over 14 years ago because she needed to earn money. Her husband sells the tinned goods made by Mavluda at the local market. They have a lot of customers as their goods are high quality. She is asking for a loan to buy tins for making these preserves. In this way her business will develop and her living conditions will be better. From the profit she is going to enter her children in good schools. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy tins for making canned goods

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 41-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has seven children and they are still in school. Genara has been in the hog raising business for ten years now. This is the source of her income. 

Genara is a hardworking woman willing to give her best to earn a living. Right now, Genara is in need of additional capital for her business growth and sustainability. She is asking for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy  additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this, Genara will be able to improve the growth of her business.

Genara dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income needed for their daily expenses and for the school fees of her children. Genara hopes to see her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
A wonderful and kind man by the name  of Hakim lives in a house which is in bad condition. He has been busy with growing potatoes and wheat for more than 5 years. He is a owner of a private farm. He has additional income from animal husbandry. His lovely wife helps him with the business. They try so hard to earn enough money for repairing their house but can’t get enough money. Hakim’s child wants to live in a house which is in good condition and that’s why Hakim is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to buy building materials as cement and paint for repairing the house.

In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy. Please, help him and his family if possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement and paint for repairing house

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI est composé de sept personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Anne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Anne est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Cyprien. Anne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Anne vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Anne vend depuis vingt ans, des ustensiles en plastiques dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Anne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Anne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group BIDOSSESSI comprises seven persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Anne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 41 years old and married to a mason named Cyprien. Anne did not go to school. The couple have five children, not all in school. One of the children remains in their care. Anne lives together with her husband and children, and along with her husband. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Anne has been selling plastic utensils at a market in Benin for twenty years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Anne, along with the other members of the group BIDOSSESSI, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils to sell

loans.name: Iris Ordelina
