texts.es: Doña Iris tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos,  su esposo es agricultor, ella es una mujer luchadora que reside en la comunidad del Bijao, de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Doña Iris inicio su negocio desde hace seis años, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general, el negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, trabaja en conjunto con una de sus hijas, la pulpería la abre desde las 6:00 am y culmina a las 9:00 pm. La ventaja es que con las ganancias de la pulpería puede ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. Doña Iris solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, jugos, leche, dulce, refrescos, verduras, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y así ofrecerles a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten. Su meta es hacer más grande la pulpería para poder establecer un minisúper. Doña Iris es el segundo ciclo que solicita en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Iris, 43, is married and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer.  She is a tenacious woman living in the community of Bijao in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.  Iris started her business six years ago.  She sells groceries in general.  She started the business on her own initiative and works with one of her daughters.  The grocery store opens at 6am and closes at 9pm.  The advantage is that she uses profits from the grocery store to help support her family.  Iris is asking for this loan to buy products like rice, sugar, lard, juices, milk, candy, soft-drinks and vegetables, among others.  With help from this loan she will be able to stock her store and offer her customers everything they need.  Her goal is to enlarge the grocery store in order to turn it into a mini supermarket.  This is the second sequence Iris has requested from FAMA; she’s made all her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alicia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married to Paul and blessed with six children that she supports. She operates a 'posho' mill as well as selling cereals, as she has done for the last 10 years. Her monthly income is KES 12,000.


She is servicing her first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD and she plans to use this to purchase more cereals for her business.


She intends to use the profits in diversifying into livestock keeping. Her future dream is to improve the family’s living standards

loans.use: to buy more cereals for her 'posho' (cornmeal) mill business

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Christopher, who is in his early 30s, is married.  He has been running a utensil business for about three years now. He works from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more plates, saucepans, paid rent, household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to restock the missing utensil items.  His dream is to one day be able to open a hotel.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Becham" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing utensil items.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is someone who has always had a strong desire to get ahead and endeavored to meet her goals. She is a married mother of two, so she works hard to provide the best to her two children, who are enrolled in school. Stella operates a retail shop selling a variety of consumer products. She has been in this business for over ten years, selling to her neighborhood. In addition, she has a small pharmacy shop selling medicines. Stella is requesting a loan from Yehu, with which she will be able to restock her shop with more inventory. With this, she will be able to purchase cereals, flour, and medicines.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, flour, and medicines.

loans.name: Wangnignigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à une même association d’entraide. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pulchérie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pulchérie est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un militaire du nom de Jean. Pulchérie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pulchérie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différentes charges, Pulchérie vend depuis une dizaine d'années, du maïs dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Pulchérie s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pulchérie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNIGBE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group WANGNIGNIGBE comprises three persons who belong to the same mutual aid association. The group's representative, Pulchérie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 36 years old and married to a soldier named Jean. Pulchérie halted her studies in primary school. The couple have five children, all in school and in their care. Pulchérie lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

To help with the different expenses, Pulchérie has been selling corn in her district for about ten years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Pulchérie, along with the other members of the group WANGNIGNIGBE, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Rosa Martha

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus hijos y nietos, lamentablemente hace poco tiempo sufrió la pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces ella es el pilar de su hogar y sus hijos y nietos son su razón principal para salir adelante; ella siempre ha sido una persona luchadora, alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que junto con su esposo dedicaron todos sus esfuerzos por convertir a sus hijos en hombres de bien, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus nietos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos postres para engreírlos.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de dulces, tales como: mazamorras, alfajores, pastelillos, entre otros; desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia la elaboración de sus dulces, para luego venderlos, ella cree que le va bien por la buena atencion y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los acabados de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ella desea poder pintar y hacer el cambio de lavadero; de esta manera Rosa contará con un baño en buenas condiciones, adecuado para su uso, así ella espera poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 62, lives in the city of Ica with her children and grandchildren.  Sadly, she suffered the loss of her beloved husband a short time ago.  Since then, she’s her home’s pillar and her children and grandchildren are her main reason to continue forward.  She’s always been a tenacious, cheerful, enthusiastic and hardworking person who with her husband dedicated all their efforts into turning their children into upstanding citizens.  In her free time she enjoys playing with her grandchildren and sometimes cooks delicious desserts to pamper them.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Rosa works day to day in her small business selling sweets like mazamorras [purple corn based pudding] and alfajores [sesame cookies], among others.  She starts making her sweets very early in the morning to then sell them.  She believes that she does well because of the good service and kind way she treats her customers.

Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided will be able to finish the bathroom at home.  She wants to be able to paint it and replace the sink so that Rosa will have a bathroom in good condition that’s appropriate for use thus providing her family with increased safety and wellbeing.

loans.use: to finish her bathroom.

loans.name: German Domingo

texts.es:
Germán es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y sus 3 amados hijos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar tiempo a la lectura de la Biblia y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el delicioso Chicharrón de Cerdo; Germán siempre ha sido un hombre muy emprendedor que ha trabajado desde muy joven, él culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Medicina Humana.
Gracias a su entusiasmo y al apoyo de su familia, desde hace unos años Germán puso en marcha su negocio de cultivo de tuna, el trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diariamente; adicionalmente también trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, él se siente muy a gusto con su negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo y el trabajo que se realiza en el.
Germán se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la infesta de cochinilla a todo su cultivo de tuna, de esta manera podrá aprovechar la estación y obtendrá abundante cría de cochinilla, así cuando la cosecha de su cultivo terminé, podrá obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas realizadas, favoreciendo de esta manera a que poco a poco Germán pueda cumplir su gran sueño de  ver a sus hijos convertidos en hombres de bien y en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Germán, 45, lives in the city of Nazca with his spouse and their three beloved children.  He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  In his free time he likes to read the Bible and sometimes prepares one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “chicharrón de cerdo.”  Germán has always been a very enterprising man who has worked since he was very young.  He completed secondary school but due to lack of resources was not able to go to university though would have liked to study human medicine.

Thanks to his enthusiasm and support from his family, a few years ago Germán started to grow prickly pears.  He works about 10 hours daily.  He also works in a small business selling groceries.  He feels very good with his business because he’s always enjoyed the countryside and the work done in it.

Germán is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to introduce cochineal into his entire prickly pear crop taking advantage of the season and obtaining an abundant growth of cochineal so that when harvest is over he’ll earn good profits from the sales thus leading to Germán being able to gradually attain his great dream which is to see his children become upstanding citizens and good professionals.

loans.use: to introduce cochineal into his cactus plants.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 50 años, está casado con Juana y tienen cuatro hijos, pero ahora solo viven con Marieni, la última. La casa donde viven la compraron hace 20 años.
Su dicho es: “Lo importante es trabajar con mucho esmero”. Todos los días se dirige a sus campos de cultivos donde tiene papa, olluco, oca y mashua, extrae la maleza y nutre con fertilizantes para que en cada cosecha le brinden buenos frutos. Además, siempre va acompañado de su esposa, quien se dedica a cuidar de sus animales (ovejas, alpacas y caballos), a los que cuida en su estancia que se ubica en la zona alta, “el clima de los animales se adapta en las altura y ahí encuentran pastos naturales para que puedan alimentarse mejor”, afirma. Por ello está planeando comprar más alpacas, para incrementar su ganado, confiesa que obtiene mejores ganancias en la venta de estos animales, como también en la venta de su lana.  

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Los quinuales” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar con su grupo, pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Jaime invertirá este dinero en la compra de 40 sacos de fertilizantes naturales “de granja” para nutrir sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Jaime, 50, is married to Juana and has four children, but only the youngest, Marieni, lives with them. They bought their house 20 years ago. His motto is: "Working with great care is important." Every day he heads for his fields, where he grows potatoes, olluco, oca, and mashua [Andean tubers], pulls weeds, and fertilizes so that each harvest will be bountiful. His wife always goes with him to care for the animals (sheep, alpaca, and horses) that are kept in the high country. "The animals adapt to the altitude, and there are natural pastures where they can eat better," he contends. They plan to increase their herd by buying more alpacas because he says selling these animals and their wool generates higher profits.

He belongs to the group “Los quinuales.” This is his second loan cycle with MFP, where he feels he has developed skills and received help to grow his business. He promises to make his payments on time. He also likes working with his group because the members are responsible and caring. Jaime will use this loan to buy 40 sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato plantings.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato plantings.

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.en: Asadullo is 25 years old and married. Asadullo has a child who is six years old.  He sells eggs  to earn a living. He has been in the business for 13 years. Through the financial support from his parents, he has managed to grow his business. He dreams of expending his business and becoming prosperous in the future. He needs a loan to buy eggs  for developing his business . He will look forward to your help.

loans.use: To buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en:
Joselinda is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or convenience store business for more than ten years now. She sells a variety of items to the people in her community. The business provides her the income that she needs for their daily expenses.

Joselinda works hard to assist her husband in making ends meet. As of now, she is in need of additional funds for her store. Joselinda is requesting a loan worth 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell like snack foods, canned goods, soap and others. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers in their locality thus augmenting her sales and profit. 

Joselinda  dreams of making her business a success so that it will generate income enough for their needs and for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like snack foods, canned goods, soap, and others

loans.name: Chey

texts.en:
Chey is a farmer from Baray district, Kampong Tom province who grows rice. She was born in a low-income family and just finished her education at primary school level due to the financial constraints of the family. Consequently, she started pursuing rice farming to help her parents. Rice farming has been her focused business ever since and up to now. Chey is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are already married while the other three are still single and have their employment in Phnom Penh.


Chey noticed that she can’t increase her rice production unless she extends her land size gradually. In connection with this, she is asking for a loan in the sums of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase extra farmland. With this purchase, she hopes to have a plentiful harvest each season and thus raise her household income. She thanks all generous lenders for their constant support.

loans.use: to purchase extra farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, también encontramos playas hermosas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, sus pobladores poseen una habilidad para la preparación de platillos ya que su comida es deliciosa y sobre todo tienen una alegría muy contagiante. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión y sobre todo comer uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca, Carlos vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene 2 maravillosos pequeños de 8 y 6 años, a quienes quiere muchísimo y sobre todo son su motor para salir adelante cada día y por quienes da la vida. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Civil.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante Carlos trabaja en su pequeño negocio como reciclador y con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de una pared como una especie de cerca, ya que debido al terremoto del 2007, su casa se cayó y de esta manera podrá tener más seguridad para su familia y seguir luchando para que poco a poco haga realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Carlos, 34, lives in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  It also has beautiful beaches and is the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  Its residents are quite skilled in preparing food since their cuisine is delicious.  Above all, they possess a contagious joy.  When he has spare time he very much enjoys watching television and above all to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.”  
Carlos lives with his wife with whom he has two wonderful little ones who are 8 and 6 and who he loves very much and are the motivating force for him to get ahead every day and for whom he gives his life.  Because of his limited economic resources he was only able to complete 11th grade but would have liked to have studies civil engineering.

With much effort and drive to get ahead, Carlos works in his small recycling business and is able to cover household expenses that way.  He works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 30 customers per day.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to build a wall because his house crumbled during the 2007 earthquake and he’ll be able to have more security for his family this way and continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality: to build his house out of substantial building materials.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 28 años, vive con sus tres hijos: Javier, Danitza y Jordi, en la casa de sus padres.
Su esposa falleció hace un año, desde entonces cuida de sus hijos solo. Su principal ingreso económico se lo da la agricultura. Siembra papa, olluco y maíz, los cuales comercializa en la ciudad, a donde viaja constantemente. También tiene animales: ovejas, vacas, cuyes y caballos, de los que también tiene ingresos por su venta; además de la leche que producen sus vacas, y cuando tiene tiempo elabora queso. Y por su fuera poco también fabrica leña con los árboles maduros, con ello cocina y vende cuando se lo piden sus vecinos.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Los quinuales” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Félix invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizantes naturales. Cada uno cuesta un promedio de 104 nuevos soles. Con los que piensa esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Félix is 28 years old and lives with his three children - Javier, Danitza, and Jordi - in his parents' house.

His wife passed away a year ago, and he has been taking care of his children by himself since then. His main financial income comes from farming. He grows potatoes, ulluco, and corn, which he sells in the city, where he constantly travels. He also has animals - sheep, cows, guinea pigs, and horses - and also obtains income from selling them, as well as from selling the milk produced by his cows, and cheese that he makes when he has time. If that weren't enough, he also makes firewood out of mature trees, which he uses for cooking and sells to his neighbors when they need it.

He belongs to the solidarity group Los Quinuales and this is his second loan with MFP. He feels fullfilled there, because he obtains the help he needs to advance his business. That is why he promises to make his payments on time.

Félix will invest the money requested in the purchase of ten sacks of natural fertilizer. They cost 104 nuevos soles each on average, and he intends to use them on his potato plants.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of natural fertilizer for his potato plants.

loans.name: Asror

texts.en:
Asror is married to a lovely woman named Shahodat and has 1 child for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. His child loves him very much because Asror is a very careful father. He is also good in business. Asror has been busy with driving for more than 2 years. He is a wonderful and sociable taxi driver. Before it he worked in Russia but his work did not satisfy him. Nowadays he is very glad with his deal and wants to develop it further. He is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy a new car.   

In this way his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which will allow him to offer his child and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung, aged 38, has a recycling business to earn income for her family. She goes through the villages to buy and collect recycled materials from local people everyday. She pulls a trailer which she owns to load the objects she collects, typically generating about 5.00 USD per day, while her husband operates a transportation business, earning around 5.00 USD as well.

Soung is the mother of five children, two of whom are married. Because another of her sons is going to be married in the next few months, Soung is requesting a loan of 800 USD for the wedding preparation and to purchase things necessary for the wedding party. She is very glad and grateful for support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding preparation and to purchase things necessary for the wedding party.

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: «MAHUTIN» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Clarisse (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans. Clarisse est mariée à un plombier du nom de Michel. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clarisse vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Clarisse a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Depuis six ans environs, Clarisse fait l’enseignement au cours maternel dans une école du Bénin. De façon secondaire à cette activité principale, Clarisse vend des fournitures scolaires dans son école. Ces activités lui permettent d’augmenter ces revenus, revenus qui l’aident à faire face aux différentes charges de son ménage. Clarisse s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Clarisse sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe « MAHUTIN » un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"MAHUTIN" is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Clarisse (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 52 years old and married to a plumber named Michel. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Clarisse lives together with her children and husband, and along with her husband, she ensures that the household expenses are covered. Clarisse halted her studies in secondary school.

For about six years, Clarisse has been teaching at a pre-school in Benin. Secondary to this primary work, she sells school supplies in her school. These activities enable her to increase her income, which helps her to cope with different household expenses. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

To respond better to the requirements of her increasingly numerous customers and to make more profit, Clarisse is requesting, along with the other members of the group "MAHUTIN", a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mergim

texts.en:
Mergim is from Kosovo. He lives in a Roma community, where loans have helped this area to improve their life and business. He is married and has four children ages one to twelve years old. Mergrim lives together with his brother’s family. They all live under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions in a small old house with three rooms. 

Mergim works on a cattle farm. He has been in his business for a long time and he doesn’t earn enough to support the needs of his family. His job is the family’s main source of income. Mergim really wanted to have his own house with a more comfortable environment for his family. 

He also thinks it is very important for his family’s health in the future. 

Recently he started to build a new small house in the same location. The money he generates from his business is not enough to finish building the house. The loan he is taking will be used to buy the building materials such as quarry stones and cement for completing the house. 

His goal is to keep improving his home to have more comfort and live in a pleasant environment with his family. 

He really appreciates all KIVA lenders!

loans.use: To buy building materials such as quarry stones and cement for building a house

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is 24 year old. She is a hardworking person who is not married. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 2 years. Her father teaches her about animal husbandry. Little by little, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals at the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are thankful for her work.
 
Tahmina is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Oluwatogni 307 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWATOGNI 307 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Fidèle Rachelle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Fidèle Rachelle est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Joseph. Fidèle Rachelle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Fidèle Rachelle est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Fidèle Rachelle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les divers besoins de la maison sont assurés par le couple. Pour contribuer à ses différents besoins, Fidèle Rachelle vend depuis une vingtaine d’années, de l’huile à moteur dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Fidèle Rachelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Fidèle Rachelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOGNI 307, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group OLUWATOGNI 307 comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Fidèle Rachelle, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and married to a man named Joseph. Fidèle Rachelle did not go to school. She is the mother of four children, all in school and in her care. She lives together with her children and husband. The diverse needs of the house are ensured by the couple. 

To help with her different needs, Fidèle Rachelle has been selling motor oil in her district for about twenty years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and in her region. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Fidèle Rachelle, along with the other members of the group OLUWATOGNI 307, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy motor oil to sell

loans.name: Ognatan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OGNATAN est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Félicienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Félicienne est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Diallo. Félicienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Félicienne vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Félicienne vend depuis huit ans, divers produits dans sa boutique située dans un quartier du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Félicienne sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe OGNATAN, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group OGNATAN comprises two persons who reside in the same district. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Félicienne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and married to a man named Diallo. Félicienne did not go to school. The couple have one child, in school and in their care. Félicienne lives together with her husband and child. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Félicienne has been selling a variety of goods in her shop located in a district in Benin, for eight years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Félicienne, along with the second member of the group OGNATAN, is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy various goods to sell in her store

loans.name: E-Koue Group

texts.fr: Le groupe E-KOUE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayoko Sèna est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayoko Sèna est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un imprimeur du nom de Cyprien. Ayoko Sèna a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Ayoko Sèna est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Ayoko Sèna vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différents besoins du foyer. Pour parvenir aux différents besoins de la famille, Ayoko Sèna vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, de la nourriture (riz préparé accompagné de la sauce) dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Ayoko Sèna s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayoko Sèna sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe E-KOUE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group E-KOUE consists of three members who live in the same district. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time to bolster their activities.

The group’s representative is Ayoko Sèna, whose hand is raised in the photo. Ayoko Sèna, age 34, attended primary school. She is married to a printer named Cyprien, and the couple have four dependent children, all in school. Ayoko Sèna and her husband live with their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

To help provide for her family, Ayoko Sèna has been selling food (a rice dish with sauce) around her neighborhood for about 15 years. This has helped her to support her family fairly easily. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to bolster her sales and revenue, Ayoko Sèna is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group E-KOUE. Their first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and condiments.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 19 años, vive en compañía de su madre, sus hermanos y su hijo de 9 meses de nacido.
Todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para cuidar de sus animales y preparar el desayuno para sus hermanos;  ya por las tardes, estudia en un colegio cerca de su casa. Ella sabe que tiene que forjarse un mejor futuro por su pequeño hijo, es así que su madre le dio una parcela de terreno para que siembre. Además cuenta que dentro de poco comenzará a trabajar en el “Wawahuasi” (guardería) de su localidad, ahí recibirá un sueldo mensual de parte del estado.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los quinuales” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida por poder recibir la ayuda económica que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Roxana invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de papa blanca.
texts.en:
Roxana is 19 years old and lives with her mother, her brothers and her 9 month old son.
She gets up very early every morning to take care of her animals and prepare breakfast for her brothers, in the afternoons she studies at a school near her home.  She know that she needs to build a better future for her small son, for this reason her mother gave her a parcel of land to cultivate.  Also, she will soon be starting to work at the  “Wawahuasi” ( a nursery) in her area.  There she will receive a monthly wage from the state.

She belongs to the group “Los quinuales” and this is her second loan with MFP.   She is very grateful for being able to get the financial help needed to meet her goals.  She promises to be punctual with the repayments.
Roxana will invest this money in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers for her next sowing of white potato.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of natural fertilizers for her next sowing of white potato..

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en:
Gelardina, who is in her early 30s, is single, with one child who still goes to school. She has been running a beauty salon for five years now. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy needed salon equipment and pay school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more needed salon equipment. Her dream is to be able to widely expand her beauty salon one day.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, Makoka, which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy needed salon equipment.

loans.name: Ma.dela Paz

texts.en:
This is Ma.Dela Paz. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and a wider variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her family's personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to meet her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma.Dela Paz hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a variety of products to expand her store's inventory.

loans.name: Avan-Nah Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVAN-NAH est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kwassialé Hermance est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kwassialé Hermance est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Norbert. Kwassialé Hermance a peu fréquenté l’école et a appris la couture. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Kwassialé Hermance vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Kwassialé Hermance exerce depuis neuf ans, la couture dans son atelier situé dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Kwassialé Hermance vend des tissus, des mèches et des produits de beauté dans son atelier. Ces activités lui permettent de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Kwassialé Hermance s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kwassialé Hermance sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AVAN-NAH, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group AVAN-NAH comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Kwassialé Hermance, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and married to a man named Norbert. Kwassialé Hermance has had little schooling but learned how to sew. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school, and both are in their care. Kwassialé Hermance lives together with her children and husband. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Kwassialé Hermance has been sewing for nine years in her workshop located in her district. Parallel to this work, she sells cloth, hair extensions, and beauty products in her shop. This work enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Kwassialé Hermance, along with the other members of the group AVAN-NAH, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy cloth, hair extensions, and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Medalith

texts.es:
La señora Medalith es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes II”, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 36 años De Edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Son dos años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de  Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de municiones, su esposo trabaja con madera (compra y venta).
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: una caja de municiones para luego venderlo al por menor.
Con este negocio está aumentando su capital como su esposo también trabaja y es el que se encarga  de los gastos del hogar,  su dinero lo sigue invirtiendo para que más adelante pueda tener su propia tienda solo espera que en un par de años pueda concretar sus sueños.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos su familia puede tener una mayor comodidad y tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Medalith is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Perseverantes II”( Persevering Women II) of the Calleria district, department of Ucayali.  She is 36 years old, married and has two children.
She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for two years and she sells munitions.  Her husband works in the buying and selling of wood.
With the new loan of 1500 new soles she will buy a case of munitions for later resale at retail.  
With this business she is increasing her income, her husband also works and he is the one that takes care of the home expenses.  She continues to invest her own money so that in the future she could have her own store.  She hopes to fulfill her dreams in a couple of years.
Thanks to Manuela Ramos her family can have more comforts and peace.

loans.use: to purchase munitions for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old. She is a single mother with two children, aged 5 and 10 years. She has a retail business in which she sells firewood to her customers. Her main clients are the factories around her area. She has been operating this business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is her fourth loan of 100,000 KES from KADET Ltd., after successfully servicing her previous loans. She will use the loan to purchase firewood for resale. 

She plans to plow the profits earned back into the business. Her dream and hope is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase wood for resale.

loans.name: Simika Group

texts.fr: La présidente  Munyerenkana est une femme ambitieuse de l’association d’affaire  Simika. Elle  est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisés. Étant au 7eme cycle de credit chez Hekima, elle sollicite ce credit pour faire accroitre son petit commerce avec 1kg de sachets emballages, 1carton de savon et 10kg de sel.  Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien.
texts.en:
Munyerenkana, president of the business group Simika, is an ambitious woman. She is a married mother of five children, three of whom have received schooling. 

This is the group’s seventh loan cycle with Hekima, and Munyerenkana plans to use her credit to expand her business. She will buy 1 kg worth of packets for packaging, 1 carton of soap, and 10 kg of salt. 

She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for its support.

loans.use: to buy 1 kg worth of packets for packaging, 1 carton of soap, and 10 kg of salt.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Deo-Gratias Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DEO-GRATIAS est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Séraphine est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Séraphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Séraphine vend des céréales (farine de manioc, maïs) et de l'huile. à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Séraphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Séraphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DEO-GRATIAS, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group DEO-GRATIAS comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the sixth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Séraphine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and married. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their care. Séraphine lives together with her children and husband. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Séraphine has been selling grains (cassava flour, corn) and oil out of her home. This work enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Séraphine, along with the other members of the group DEO-GRATIAS, is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy grains (cassava flour, corn) and some oil to sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Мунира жительница города Исфара. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж уехал на заработки за границу. Сама Мунира предоставляет услугу, она портниха. Мунира занимается шитьем у себя дома. Она в основном шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности Мунира занимается 17 лет. 
Мунира берет кредит для покупки тканей. Она хочет приобрести и привезти ткани из города Худжанд.
texts.en: Munira is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 32 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband left to work abroad.  Munira provides a service; she is a seamstress.  She is involved in sewing at home.  She primarily sews national dresses.  Munira has been in this business for 17 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics.  She wants to buy and bring fabrics from the city of Khujand.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Matlubakhon

texts.ru:
Матлубахон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. Матлубахон занимается переработкой и торговлей сухофруктов. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более пяти лет. 
Матлубахон берет кредит для приобретения сухофруктов.
texts.en: Matlubakhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 23 years old, married.  Matlubakhon is involved in processing and selling dried fruits.  She has been in this business for over five years.  Matlubakhon is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифчон проживает в районе Шахринав. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Орифчон уже 19 лет предоставляет услугу на своем грузовом автомобиле. Он имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Орифчон берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля, чтобы продолжит свою деятельность.
texts.en: Orifjon lives in the Shahrinav district.  He is 41 years old, married and has three children.  Orifjon has been providing a service on his truck.  He has a rich experience in this field.  Orifjon is requesting this loan to repair is truck in order to continue his work.

loans.use: to repair his truck

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба проживает в городе Дангара. Ей 28 лет. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок. Махбуба занимается шитьем. Она более пяти лет занимается этим видом деятельности. Махбуба берет заказы на дому. 
Махбуба просит кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mahbuba lives in the city of Dangara.  She is 28 years old, a widow and has one child.  Mahbuba is involved in sewing.  She has been in this business for over five years.  Mahbuba accepts her orders at home.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rajamo

texts.ru:
Рачамо родилась 1961 году в Дангаре. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Рачамо является любимой бабушкой. Двое ее сыновей занимаются торговлей в городе Душанбе. Дочь Рачамо портниха.
Рачамо трудолюбивая и пробивная женщина. Она более пятнадцати лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В этой области она имеет богатый опыт.
Рачамо просит кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки свой дочери, чтобы она смогла самостоятельно заняться шитьем платьев.
texts.en: Rajamo was born in 1961 in Dangara.  She is married and has three children.  Rajamo is a beloved grandmother.  Two of her sons are involved in sales in the city of Dushanbe.  Rajamo's daughter is a seamstress.  Rajamo is a hardworking and progressive woman.  She has been involved in sewing national dresses for over fifteen years.  She has a rich experience in this field.  Rajamo is requesting this loan to purchase a new sewing machine for her daughter, so that she could be sewing dresses independently.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for milk in various sizes and sell it again

loans.name: Laou-Rou Group

texts.fr: «LAOU-ROU» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Philomène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Philomène est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Moutaïrou. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Philomène n’a jamais été à l’école. Depuis dix huit ans environs, Philomène vend des jus de citron et de la bouillie (faite à base du maïs et accompagné du lait) dans un quartier du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet d’augmenter ces revenus, revenus qui l’aident à faire face aux différentes charges de son ménage. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Philomène sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « LAOU-ROU» un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
"LAOU-ROU" is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Philomène (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a retailer named Moutaïrou. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Philomène lives together with her children and husband, and along with him, she ensures that the household expenses are covered.

Philomène never went to school. For about eighteen years, she has been selling lime drinks and porridge (made from corn and served with milk) in a district in Benin. This business enables her to increase her revenues, which help her to cope with different household expenses. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

To respond better to the requirements of her increasingly numerous customers and to make more profit, Philomène, along with the other members of the group "LAOU-ROU", is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy limes and some corn and milk to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Amangul

texts.en:
Mrs. Amangul is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her son, age 2. She lives in the western province of Mongolia. 

Amangul started a hand embroidery business in 2004. She improved her business and established her own private company. Her company has 3 staff members. They produce national hats, deels (Mongolian traditional clothes), wallets, and handbags. She uses fabric waste from a sewing factory to make her products. Mostly she sells her products to foreign tourists and exports to England and USA.

Since the national Eagle`s holiday is taking place soon, the demand for her products will increase. Therefore, she is requesting a 6,000,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) loan to buy raw materials and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Iche-Otan Group

texts.fr: «ICHE-OTAN» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Nafiratou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 63 ans. Nafiratou est une veuve et est mère de six enfants dont aucun scolarisé. Parmi les enfants, un seul reste à la charge de Nafiratou. Nafiratou vit seule avec son enfant. Nafiratou assure seule ses différents besoins ainsi que ceux de son enfant. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Nafiratou mène comme activité la vente des tissus et des pièces de moto dans certaines régions du Bénin. Nafiratou exerce cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Nafiratou sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe «ICHE-OTAN» un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
"ICHE-OTAN" is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Nafiratou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 63 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, none of whom are in school. Among the children, one remains in her care. Nafiratou lives alone with her child. She ensures by herself that her different needs and those of her child are met. 

To cope with her different expenses, Nafiratou has a business selling cloth and spare parts for motorbikes in certain regions of Benin. She has been in this business for about twenty years and gets her supplies from a market in Benin and from Nigeria. 

To respond better to the requirements of her increasingly numerous customers and to make more profit, Nafiratou, along with the other members of the group "ICHE-OTAN", is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and to grow their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy cloth and some spare parts to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes II” del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 46 años, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos dos todavía viven con ella.
Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo: ropa, perfumes, joyas, etc; lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, los mismos que le han sirvido para poder trabajar con más tranquilidad y poder vender a crédito a sus clientes y le puedan pagar en partes.  Su esposo trabaja como docente (profesor) en un colegio público.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará: 12 blusas, 6 pantalones, 12 polos para niños, 12 polos para adultos, 6 pantalones para hombres.  
Con los descuentos que tiene por la venta de sus productos tiene buenas ganancias y espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Mrs Doris is member of the community bank “Mujeres Perseverantes II” (Persevering Women II) of the Calleria district, department of Ulcayali.  She is 46 years old, married and has four children, two of whom still live at home.
She makes a living selling items through a catalog; clothing, perfumes, jewelry, etc..  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for two years.  These have allowed her to work with more peace and be able to sell to her customers on credit which they can repay in installments.  Her husband works as a teacher in a public school.
With the new loan of 1000 new soles she will buy 12 blouses, 6 pairs of pants, 12 polo shirts for children, 12 polo shirts for adults, 6 pairs of men's pants. With the discounts that she gets she makes good profits from her sales.  She hopes to continue working with Manuela Ramos for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, polo shirts, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 33 años, vive con sus dos hijos: Madeleine y Dic, en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 14 años.
Hace un año falleció su esposo, desde entonces con mucho coraje, esfuerzo y amor por sus hijos se dedicó a trabajar con mucho más ahínco en sus sembríos de habas, olluco, papa, oca y mashua. Ya tiene 18 años de experiencia en este actividad, cada cosecha la comercializa en la ciudad, donde ella misma viaja tres veces por semana; “obtengo más ganancias de esa forma”, comenta. Aún no cuenta con terrenos propios, pero está ahorrando para comprarse unos.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los quinuales” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y además le gusta trabajar con su grupo, pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Bertha invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 65 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su siembra de papa.
texts.en: Bertha is 33 years old and lives with her two children, Medeleine and Dic, in the house she inherited from her parents 14 years ago. One year ago, her husband died. Since then, with great courage, effort, and love for her children, she has eagerly dedicated herself to working in her fields of fava beans, olluco, potatoes, oca, and mashua. She already has 18 years of experience in this work. She sells each harvest in the city, where she travels three times a week. "I earn more this way," she explains. She still doesn't have her own fields, but she is saving up to buy land. She belongs to the solidarity group "Los Quinuales." This is her second loan with MFP, where she feels supported because she gets help so she can move forward. For that reason, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Plus, she likes working with her group because they are responsible and supportive people. Bertha will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of 65 sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato crop.

loans.use: to purchase 65 sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato crop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 45 años, esta casada con Ricardo, tienen siete hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cinco de ellos, en la casa que compraron hace 20 años.
Desde 18 años, cuando conformó su familia empezó a sembrar papa, olluco, mashua y oca, lo hace junto a su esposo; fertilizan y limpian sus cultivos con mucha dedicación. En todo este tiempo lograron muchas cosas, como adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Pero esa no es la única actividad de esta pareja,  también tejen mantas de lana típicas, con lo que obtienen un dinero extra. A su vez, Juana cría y vende de animales (ovejas, cerdos y burros para carga). Su esposo comenzará a trabajar en una mina, por lo que está contenta con el dinero que recibirán de ese trabajo, el cual podrán usar para incrementar su producción agrícola.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los quinuales” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida por la ayuda económica que recibe para lograr sus objetivos. Por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Juana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 100 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa que piensa sembrar en estos días.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old and is married to Ricardo. They have seven children, but only five currently live with them in the home they purchased twenty years ago.

Ever since she started a family at eighteen, she and her husband started growing potatoes, ulluco, mashua, and oca. They fertilize and clear their crops with lots of dedication. Over all this time, they have made many achievements, such as acquiring their own farm land. But that is not this couple's only business. Thay also weave traditional wool blankets, which provide them with some extra money. Juana also raises and sells animals (sheep, pigs, and working donkeys). Her husband is going to start working in a mine, so she is happy with the money they will receive from that job, which they will be able to use to increase their agricultural production.

She belongs to the solidarity group Los Quinuales and this is her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial help she receives in order to achieve her goals. That is why she promises to make her payments on time.

Juana will invest the money requested in the purchase of 100 sacks of natural fertilizer to use on the potatoes she currently intends to plant.

loans.use: to purchase 100 sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato plants.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito Coronel portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Tiene dos años de haber reingresado a este banco comunal  que le dió acogida nuevamente porque es una socia muy puntual.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará los materiales que le hacen falta para trabajar: 5 kilos de tela algodón, 2 conos de elásticos, 3 colores de cinta, 10 metros de pasa cinta, 6 metros de blonda, 1 docena de botones, una docena de encarrojadores.
Trabaja para darle a su hijo todo lo que necesita y pueda estudiar tranquilo.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de estar en este banco comunal, nos cuenta que las socias son como su familia y se llevan muy bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susana is a member of the community bank "Mujeres de Exito" (Successful Women) of the Coronel Portillo district, department of Ucayali.  She is 50 years old, single and has one son.
She has joined this bank two years ago and they once again took her in because she is a very punctual member.
With the new loan of 1000 new soles she will buy materials that she needs to be able to work; 5 kilos of cotton cloth,  2 spools of elastic, 3 colors of ribbon, 10 meters of yarn, 6 meters of lace, one dozen buttons, a dozen zippers.
She works so that her son has all that he needs and can study.  She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to belong to this community bank.  She tells us that the members are like family and get along very well.

loans.use: to purchase fabric at wholesale, elastic, ribbon, etc.

loans.name: Angelica Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos a su cargo.
Lleva tres años y medio integrando este banco comunal y se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza en las fiestas sociales que son los fines de semana y por las noches, muchas veces e realizan muy lejos de su casa y tiene que transportar sus cosas, gracias a su esfuerzo cuenta con movilidad propia.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 fuentes con tapas, 2 cientos de platos descartables, 1 paquete de bolsa, 2 galones de aceite, 4 paquetes de palitos, 1 balón de gas.
Con dos hijos que atender tiene que salir a trabajar, para poder mantenerlos y que no les falte nada, uno de sus hijos le ayuda a transportar sus productos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darles los créditos para continuar trabajando sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the “Mujeres De Éxito” [Successful Women] communal bank in the Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 44 years old, single, and has two children under her care. 

She has been a member of this communal bank for three and a half years.  She sells food at parties on the week-ends and evenings.  Many times the parties are very far from her house, and she has to transport her things.  Thanks to her effort, she has her own transportation.

With the new loan for 1,000 soles she will buy three beverage dispensers, two hundred disposable plates, one package of bags, two gallons of oil, four packages of skewers, and one tank of gas.

With two children to care for she needs to go to work in order to be able to support them, and so they will not need anything.  One of her children helps her transport her products.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos for giving them the loans in order to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to buy beverage dispensers, plates, and bags.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, a 38-year-old hardworking and joyful woman, lives with the father of her five children in a rental house in the coastal region of Kenya. Jackline sells groceries in a small grocery store which has been running for the last three years. She likes her work since it allows her to socialize with her neighbors, have more friendships, talk about things that interest her, and feel like a busy and productive person. Thanks to the income, she’s been able to meet the household expenses.

This will be Jackline's second loan with Yehu, and she’s happy to get the help and advance her business. For that reason she promises to be punctual in the repayment of her loan.

With the amount of 30,000 KES that she’s requested, she’ll invest in the purchase of groceries such as tomatoes, potatoes, kale, bananas, etc. to expand the supply of merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries including tomatoes, potatoes, kale, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene 56 años, está casada con Teodoro, con quien tiene seis hijos. Ahora ellos viven solos, en la casa que heredó de su madre hace 30 años.
Desde que se unió con su esposo comenzó a dedicarse a la ganadería. En la actualidad tiene cinco vacas de las que extrae leche para la elaboración de queso. Hace 35 años conoció a un minero que le propuso llevar quesos a los trabajadores de la mina, y ahora continúa llevando queso al mismo campamento minero, cada 15 días. Poco a poco ganó los clientes que ahora tiene, lleva gran cantidad de queso, por lo que su propia producción no le abastece y tiene que comprar más a otros ganaderos. Se siente feliz, pues pudo obtener muchas ganancias, incluso brindar a sus hijos una buena educación. Ahora desea juntar el dinero suficiente para poder comprar más vacas lecheras y así tener una mayor producción de queso. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Estrellitas” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, está segura que con el apoyo económico que está recibiendo podrá mejorar su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que gusta de ser una persona responsable. 
Clotilde invertirá este dinero en la compra de aproximadamente 700 quesos.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 56 years old and is married to Teodoro. They have six children together. They currently live alone in the home she inherited from her mother thirty years ago.

Ever since she married her husband, she started working with livestock. Currently she has five cows, from which she obtains milk to make cheese. Thirty-five years ago, she met a miner who suggested she bring her heads of cheese to the mine workers, and she now still takes her cheese to the same mining camp every two weeks. Little by little she gained the customers she now has, and she brings them large amounts of cheese, which is why her own production is not enough and she has to buy more from other stock farmers. She is happy because she has been able to make a very good profit and even provide her children with a good education. Now she wants to put together enough money to buy more dairy cows, so that she can produce more cheese.

She belongs to the solidarity group Estrellitas and this is her first loan with MFP. She is certain that she will be able to improve her business with the financial support she is receiving. She also promises to make her payments on time, since she prides herself on being a responsible person.

Clotilde will invest this money in the purchase of approximately 700 heads of cheese.

loans.use: to purchase approximately 700 heads of cheese.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es:
El señor Ronaldo tiene la edad de 57 años, se dedica al sector agricola y principalmente a la siembra de maíz y sorgo, habita en la comunidad el  Tololar, municipio de posoltega, Es casado y con 4 hijos, de los cuales solo 1 está dentro de su carga familiar, ya que los otros son independientes.

el inicio con su padre desde muy pequeño lo que nos indica que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el sector agrícola, pero fue hasta hace 12 años que se independizo. Don Ronaldo es una persona trabajadora, responsable y de muy buenas costumbres, lo que le ha permitido crecer cada día en su negocio de la agricultura, además que su trabajo le permite llevar el sustento hasta su hogar. A través de los financiamientos ha logrado cumplir sus metas las cuales son poder acudir sus cultivos dándoles un buen tratamiento y así poder obtener una cosecha de calidad.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is 57 and has worked in agriculture for the last 12 years has been growing corn and sorghum; he lives in the community of Tololar, municipality de Posoltega.  He’s married and has four children only one of which is still in his care since the others are all independent.

Ronaldo started out when he was still very young with his father so he comments that he has vast experience in the agricultural sector.  He has been farming on his own for 12 years now. Ronaldo is responsible and hardworking and has very good values which have made it possible for him to grow more each day as a farmer.  In addition, his work makes it possible for him to provide daily sustenance for his home.  Through the loans he’s managed to reach his goals which are to be able to care for his crops giving them good care in order to attain quality harvests.

loans.use: to pay farming costs. compra de insumos agricolas(urea y para dar dos pases de grada en tres manzanas de sorgo)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar as well as drinks, and, if possible, several guinea pigs to cook.

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.ru: Рокия проживает в городе Дангара. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Сама Рокия имеет среднее образование. Она уже год как занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Рокия берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Rokiya lives in the city of Dangara.  She is 36 years old, married and has four children.  Her children attend a school.  Rokiya has a secondary education.  She has been involved in sewing national dresses for one year.  Rokiya is requesting this loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nyawa

texts.en:
Nyawa makes a living tailoring and selling clothing together with his family. He relies on several machines and the help of his family to perform his tailoring jobs. He sells his products in a commercial shop.

He always makes an effort and tries to get ahead. He is requesting another loan to buy material and thread for tailoring a quantity of clothing that will allow him to have a stock of varied and attractive garments for the public.

loans.use: to buy material and thread and bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en: Lilian is in her early 20s, single and has been earning a living for the last six months by selling women's clothing. She works from eight o'clock in the morning to as late as six o'clock in the evening every day. She is doing well and is able to earn a fair monthly profit. She is applying for her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. She will share this loan with her group  “Zebra,“ which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 37 years old, married and lives in Bohol, Philippines. For the last several years, she has earned a living by selling snacks to people who live in her community. Her husband is a fisherman. Josephine works hard to help her husband meet their family's needs. She is in need of additional capital for her business, and is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional items to sell and to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to make her business grow and be sustainable so that it will generate more income. This will allow her to continue sending her children to school so they can get a good education and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nery Xiomara

texts.es:
Nery Xiomara Vive en el municipio de El Sauce, es soltera,  trabaja actualmente como secretaria en una Institución y además tiene su propio negocio ubicado en su vivienda el cual consiste en la venta de ropa y bisutería, en sus días libres atiende dicho negocio o visita a sus propios clientes.

En El Sauce es conocida como una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que ha salido siempre adelante por sí  sola que desde muy temprana edad sus padres le enseñaron el amor al trabajo y a ganarse sus propios ingresos para no depender de nadie y tener un mejor futuro.
 Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de medicina en general, ya que en los últimos días se ha sentido mal de salud y quiere mejorar para desempeñar mejor su labor con el propósito de ascender a un mejor cargo y tener un mejor nivel social y económico.
Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha con KIVA y Ceprodel por este apoyo brindado a las personas asalariadas de bajo recursos que necesitan de esta mano amiga para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nery Xiomara lives in the municipality of El Sauce.  She is single and she currently works as a secretary in an institution.  She also has her own home business selling clothing and costume jewelry.  On her days off she tends that business or visits her customers herself. 

She is known in El Sauce as an enterprising and hardworking woman who has always gotten ahead on her own.  When she was just a little girl, her parents taught her to love her work and to make her own money so she would not have to depend on anyone and so she would have a better future.

She is asking for this loan to buy general medicines, as she has not been feeling well lately and she wants to feel better so she can do a better job at work.  Her goal is to be promoted to a better position and have a better social and financial standing.

She is very thankful to and satisfied with Kiva and Ceprodel for the help they offer wage-earning people with scarce resources who need a helping hand to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Abertina Maria

texts.es:
La señora Albertina tiene la edad de 36 años, es casada y tiene una hija en edad escolar, ella estudio en el colegio la normal chinandega que es en donde se graduo de maestra de educacion primaria, actualmente labora en el centro escolar publico Julia Martinez Toruño en donde se desempeña como maestra de primaria desde hace 12 años. En la foto podemos observar que ella se encuentra en su lugar de trabajao en donde impartia la clase a sus alumnos.
Ademas en su casa de habitacion tiene un molino en donde brinda servicio para moler maiz y carne de res, el cual lo tiene establecido desde hace 2 años y de este pequeño negocio se encarga su esposo.
Es una persona con deseos de superacion y muy responsable, este crédito lo necesita para compra de medicamentos ya que tiene problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Sra. Albertina is 36 years old, married, and has a daughter who is of school age.  She studied at a teacher’s college in Chinandega and graduated to become an elementary school teacher.  Albertina currently teaches at the Julia Martinez Toruño School where she has been employed for the past 12 years.  In the photo, she is seen in the classroom where she teaches her students.  

Albertina also owns a mill at her home which she uses to provide services, such as grinding corn or meat.  She established this small business two years ago and her husband manages it.  Albertina is a person who has the drive to succeed and be responsible.  This loan will be use to buy medicine to treat her health problems.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Luis Ángel .

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una hermosa y bella ciudad minera, donde producen el oro y dedicada a sus actividades comerciales ubicado en el departamento de León.

El señor Luis Ángel  se dedica principalmente a la compra y venta de granos básicos, sale diario a las comarcas aledañas para hacer su compra para luego Llevarlo hasta el departamento a realizar la venta.


Actualmente se presentó a Ceprodel  con   el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Maíz Trigo y Frijoles, para el mejoramiento de su negocio.
