Agradezco a dios con mucho amor por haberle dado la oportunidad de haber conocido a Ceprodel y Kiva que estos le han brindado la ayuda que tanto necesita ya que esto lo ha mejorado en toda sus actividades de su negocio y también ha mejorado su vida familia

Luis Ángel le agradece de todo corazón a Ceprodel y Kiva por haber puesto confianza sobre él y espera le puedan brindar el apoyo.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a beautiful mining town that produces gold and is located in the León department of Nicaragua. His main line of work is buying and selling grain. Every day he travels to the neighbouring regions to buy products, which he then takes back to his own region to sell. 

He has applied for a loan via Ceprodel  so that he can buy corn, wheat and beans to improve his business. He is very grateful to God for having given him the opportunity to learn about Ceprodel and Kiva. These organisations have given him much-needed assistance which has improved all areas of his business as well as his family life.

Luis Angel would like to thank Ceprodel and Kiva from the bottom of his heart for having believed in him and he hopes that they will be able to support him.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and beans.

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es:
En Santa Rosa del Peñón, Un Bello Municipio que se dedica al comercio, donde se explota principalmente el Oro y Yeso.  

El señor Pablo Alfonzo  cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en la Venta de Ropa Ambulante en diferentes comarcas aledañas, sale todo los días a las comarca a ofrecer su mercado, de la misma forma aprovecha a venderle diferente tipo de calsados a trabajadores de su zona, es de esta forma que él se gana el pan de cada día.
Actualmente esta solicitando  un crédito a través de Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de ropas tales como: pantalones de Mujer y Varón, ropa interior, blusas, faldas entre otros. 
  . 
Agradezco a Dios con mucho aprecio por haberse encontrado en su vida a Ceprodel y Kiva ya que estos le han brindado su ayuda y se siente muy agradecido esperando que siempre sigan existiendo para así obtener  mucho más ingresos  para  mejorar  en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Pablo Alfonzo lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a beautiful town that is home to gold and gypsum mining companies. He has his own business selling men’s and ladies’ clothes as a street vendor. Every day he travels to the neighbouring regions to sell his products. He also sells different types of footwear to workers from his own region. This is how he earns his daily bread.  

He has applied for a loan via Ceprodel and Kiva so that he can buy clothing such as men’s and ladies’ trousers, underwear, blouses, skirts etc.

He is very grateful to God for having brought Ceprodel and Kiva into his life. These organisations have helped him and he is very thankful. He hopes that they will continue to exist so that he can increase his income and thus improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as men’s and ladies’ trousers, underwear, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos.
Es reingresante en el banco comunal, su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos (habitaciones) por lo cual recibe mensualmente un dinero en calidad de alquiler.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 planchas de triplay, 1 kilo de clavos, 1 balde de pintura, 6 listones, que necesita para poder arreglar un nuevo cuarto y alquilarlo.
Tiene a su cargo a su papá que es un ancianito y necesita bastante cuidado, su hija y sus dos nietos también viven con ella.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos tiene este pequeño negocio porque le dieron el capital que necesitaba.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank Mujeres De Éxito in the district of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 59 years old and is a single mother. She has three children.

She has returned to the communal bank and her business is renting rooms, for which she charges a monthly rate.

She will use her new loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase five planks of plywood, two pounds of nails, a bucket of paint, and six lengths of lumber, which she needs in order to fix up a new room to rent.

She is responsible for her father, who is an elderly man and needs quite a bit of care, her daughter, and her two grandchildren, who also live with her.

She has her small business thanks to Manuela Ramos, because they gave her the capital she needed.

loans.use: to purchase paint and construction material.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy valiente, vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su hijo, a quien cuida sola.  
Como buena mujer del campo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pero su principal ingreso económico se centra en la producción de leche. Posee cinco vacas de buena raza, de las que diariamente extrae leche para vender a una empresa procesadora; “es una de la más grandes del Perú, gracias a la producción de mis vacas, tengo un ingreso diario”, menciona. Al día producen un promedio de 36 litros de leche, que no es fijo, pues todo depende de la alimentación que les de. Por ello, desea obtener más vacas de buena calidad, para poder producir más leche y así obtener mayores ganancias.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores Huallhua” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo ha aprovechado el dinero recibido para mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo, porque todos se ayudan entre sí.
Felicita invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de otra vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Felicita is a very courageous 51-year-old woman. She lives in her parents' house together with her son, whom she cares for by herself.

As a good country woman, she works in agriculture and livestock. She sows her own agricultural fields, but her main economic income is centered around the production of milk. She has five well-bred cows, from which she gets milk every day to sell to a processing business. "It's one of the biggest in Peru. Thanks to my cows' production, I have daily income," she says. They produce an average of 36 liters of milk per day; it's not a fixed amount, as everything depends on the feed she gives them. She wishes to obtain more good quality cows to be able to produce more milk and thus earn more money.

Felicita belongs to the communal bank "Productores Huallhua," and this is her second loan with MFP. In this time, she has taken advantage of the money she received to improve her business. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments, and she likes working with her group because they all help each other.

Felicita will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of another milk cow.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 26 años, está casada con Percy, con quien tiene dos hijos, a los que educa con mucho amor. Ellos viven en su casa propia, la cual obtuvieron luego de muchos años de trabajo.
Ella siembra en los terrenos que le heredó de su padre. Hace poco tuvo la idea de alquilar un puesto en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad capital, donde viaja dos veces a la semana para vender sus productos (papa, alverja, habas y demás verduras), además de carne de res. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pues su secreto es vender lo que ella misma produce, de esa manera obtiene más ingresos, ya que no compra a terceros. “Hay días en los que no me abastezco, por lo que tengo que comprar a otros agricultores de mi pueblo”, afirma. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores Huallhua” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además que le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos se ayudan entre sí.
Elva invertirá este dinero en la compra de kilos de carne y sacos de verdura para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Elva, 26, is married to Percy with whom she has two children who she raises with much love.  They live in their own house they acquired after many years of work.

She plants on land she inherited from her father.  A short time ago she got the idea of leasing a stand in one of the capital city’s most important markets where she goes to twice a week to sell her products (potatoes, peas, lima beans and other vegetables) as well as beef.  She does very well in her business because her secret is selling what she produces herself thus obtaining more income because she does not buy from third parties.  “There are days when I don’t have enough and have to buy other products in my town,” she affirms.

She belongs to the “Productores Huallhua” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  She enjoys working with her group because they all help each other out.  She will use this money to buy kilos of meat and sacks of vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Amira

texts.ru: Амире 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Сыну 5 лет, а дочке 3 года. Амира занимается торговлей женской одеждой и обувью уже 6-лет. До этого она зарабатывала в России вместе с мужем как трудовой мигрант в качестве горничной, а муж работал шофером. Когда она вернулась на родину, она начала свой бизнес. Прошли годы, и Амира усовершенствовала свои знания в бизнесе. Амира успешная бизнес леди.  В  ООО МЗО «Имон-Интернешнл» она обращается седьмой раз с целью получение кредита, для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Amira is 29 years old.  She is married and raising two children.  Her son is five years old, and daughter is three years old.  Amira has been involved in selling women's clothing for six years.  Previously, she earned a living in Russia together with her husband as a maid labor migrant, and her husband worked as a driver.  She started her own business when she returned to her homeland.  Years have passed, and Amira mastered her knowledge in the business.  Amira is a successful business lady.  This is her seventh time coming to "Imon-International" with the goal of obtaining a loan to refill her working capital.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seasonable clothing and develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to divide her business and home.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La señora Inocencia es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad.
Lleva trece años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comida, alquila un pequeño puesto el cual es muy concurrido porque está cerca de una plaza, esta actividad la realiza por las tardes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: docenas de platos pequeños, 1 ciento de platos descartables, un balde de mayonesa, un balde de checkchu y un balde  mostaza, 2 paquetes de bolsa chequera, 5 kilos de chancho, 2 galones de aceite, 1 racimo de plátano, 10 kilos de papa, 1 balón de gas.
Todos los días tiene que ir a trabajar para poder comprar las medicinas de su esposo que es una persona enferma al que tiene que atender, cuando tiene que ir a trabajar un persona tiene que cuidar de él, agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle todo la ayuda necesaria para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres De Éxito (Successful Women)" in the Calleria District, Department of Ucayali.  She is 57 years old, married and has three adult children.

Inocencia has been working for thirteen years with the loans from Manuela Ramos selling food.  She rents a small place which is very popular because it is near a plaza.  She sells in the afternoons.

With her new loan of S /. 3,000.00 soles she will buy: dozens of small plates, 100 disposable plates, a bucket of mayonnaise, a bucket of ketchup and and a bucket of mustard, 2 packets of plastic bags, 5 kilos of pork, 2 gallons of oil, 1 bunch of bananas, 10 kilos of potatoes, and 1 gallon of gas.

Every day Inocencia has to go to work to afford the medicines for her husband who is ill and has to be attended to.  When she has to go to work someone needs to take care of him.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving all the help necessary to continue working.

loans.use: to buy oil, dishes, bags, and supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 39 años, está casada con Luis, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Ellos viven en la casa que pudieron comprar hace 2 años.  
Se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, pero de donde obtiene mayores ingresos es de la ganadería; “cuidar de los animales, siempre me gusto”, afirma. Tiene vacas, ovejas y toros, los cuales compra en mal estado y ella misma se encarga de alimentarlos cuidarlos y mantenerlos saludables; “los cuido por meses, hasta que se encuentren maduros”, comenta. Luego de sus cuidados los comercializa en la feria ganadera que se realiza en la ciudad. Le parece muy rentable su negocio, pues es una de las pocas que tiene muchos años dedicándose a este negocio en su zona.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores Huallhua” y este es su crédito número 7 con MFP. En todo este tiempo ha aprovechado el dinero de los préstamos para mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además que le gusta trabajar con su grupo, porque todos se ayudan entre sí.
Esta vez, Lucia invertirá el dinero en la compra de dos toros.
texts.en:
Lucia, 39, is married to Luis with whom she has five children.  They live in the house they were able to buy two years ago.   She works in agriculture and raising cattle but her larger profits come from the cattle business.  “I’ve always liked taking care of animals,” she affirms.  She has cows, sheep and bulls that she buys in poor shape and then feeds them, cares for them and brings back to health.  “I care for them for months until they mature,” she comments.  After caring for them she sells them in her city’s livestock fair.  She feels her business is very profitable because it’s one of the things she’s been doing for many years in her area.

She belongs to the “Productores Huallhua” communal bank and this is her MFP loan #7.  During all this time she’s used the money from the loans to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Also, she enjoys working with her group because they all help each other out.  This time, Lucia will use the money to buy two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 27 años, desde hace 6 años vive en una casa que alquilada, junto a su esposo Jhon y sus tres hijos.  
Hace poco incursionó en la compra y venta de animales, antes de que comenzara en este negocio ayudaba a su esposo en el oficio de construcción; “él tiene muchos contratos, para muy ocupado”, comenta. Es así que decidió tener un negocio propio, ya que su objetivo es ahorrar el dinero que gane para poder comprar su propia casa. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de animales, los que engorda para luego venderlos a un mayor precio, le gusta comprar más cerdos, ya que su cuidado es mucho más sencillo y siempre hay demanda en las festividades de su localidad.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Pueblo nuevo” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP, se siente bien trabajando en su banco comunal, pues recibe consejos para mejorar sus plantaciones, ya que todos son agricultores como ella. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Norma invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de diez cerdos.
texts.en:
Norma, 27, has been living in a rented house for the last six years with her husband, Jhon, and their three children.

A short time ago she started to buy and sell livestock.  Prior to starting this business she was helping her husband with his occupation in construction.  “He has many contracts; he’s very busy,” she comments.  She decided to have a business of her own because her objective is to save money so that she can buy a house.  Her work consists in buying animals that she fattens up to then sell at a higher price.  What she likes best is to buy pigs because their care is much simpler and demand is always high during local festivities.

She belongs to the “Pueblo Nuevo” (New Town) communal bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  She feels good working in her communal bank because she gets advice on improving her crops since they are all farmers like her.  Also, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Norma will use the money from this loan to buy ten pigs.

loans.use: to buy ten pigs.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is married with three children.  She is 63 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban in the Philippines.  Tita is a farmer and plants nipa (a type of palm) to earn a living.  She has been doing this for three years.  Tita has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional materials for her nipa growing business.  Tita has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, she hopes to save money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her nipa growing business.

loans.name: Tuungane/kavumu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukuzo est présidente du groupe de credit Tuungane.  Agée de 35 ans est veuve et mère  de 6 enfants dont 4 sont scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des produits vivriers depuis son enfance grâce à l’épargne de son père; étant aujourd’hui au 7eme cycle de credit chez Hekima elle sollicite ce credit pour lui permettre l’approvisionnement  de 170kg de haricots. Elle craint l’insécurité dans le milieu mais pense qu’avec le prêt de Hekima elle pourra aller de l’avant et louer son propre dépôt de haricot. Nous signalons deux cas des mamans qui portent leurs bébés sur la photos.
texts.en:
Mukuzo is president of the Tuungane credit group.  She is a 35-year-old widow and mother of six children, four of whom are in school.  Thanks to her father's savings, she has been selling staple products since she was a child.  Currently on her seventh loan cycle with Hekima, she is requesting this loan in order to buy 170 kg of beans.  She worries about insecurity in the area, but thinks that with Hekima's loan she will be able to go forward and rent her own bean warehouse.  

Note on the photo:  There are two mothers in the photo holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy 170 kg of beans.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Doris Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes” del Distrito coronel portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Son seis años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un negocio bien formal que es la venta de repuestos de carros y también brinda servicio mecánico, para lo cual cuenta con una persona experta en la materia.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 6 faros, 6 micas, Una caja de focos, una suspensión, una caja de transmisión, 4 frenos, una docena  de fajas, 1 caja de bujías, 1 caja de aceite para frenos, 2 coronas completas.
Su trabajo se encuentra instalado en su misma casa, lo bueno es que trabaja junto con su esposo, se turnan para quedarse en su negocio, cuando tienen que hacer pagos a sus proveedores generalmente es ella quien se encarga de ello.  Espera seguir  trabajando para  poder implementar más  su negocio, está muy contenta con Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 27-years-old, married and has three children.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for six years.  She has quite a formal business.  She sells auto spare parts and provides auto repair services; she has an expert in the field on hand.

She will use her new, 3,000 new sol, loan to buy six headlamps, six light covers, a box of light bulbs, one suspension, a gear box, four brakes, a dozen belts, a box of spark plugs, a box of brake fluid and two complete differentials.

Her business is located at home.  The good thing is that she works alongside her husband.  They take turns watching the business.  When they need to pay suppliers she usually takes care of that.  She hopes to continue working to equip her business more.  She’s happy with Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to move her business and her family forward.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 50 años, está casada con Antonio, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con uno de ellos. La casa donde viven la heredó de sus padres hace 24 años en la localidad de Pueblo Nuevo.  
Desde muy niña aprendió el cuidado de la tierra; “nací, crecí y moriré en el campo”, comenta muy contenta. Sus propios terrenos agrícolas los tiene desde hace 30 años, comenzó a sembrar de manera independiente papa, olluco, alverja y habas en grandes cantidades. Junto a su esposo cuidan de los sembríos, fertilizando y limpiando la maleza que crece entre los surcos. Para la venta ya cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo menor; “llevo a mi hijo para que cuente el dinero y me ayude en la negociación”, comenta. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Pueblo nuevo” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. Se siente bien trabajando en su banco comunal porque recibe consejos para mejorar sus plantaciones, pues todos son agricultores como ella. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que todos son responsables. 
Teodora invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 300 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para distribuir en sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en: Teodora is 50 years old and married to Antonio, with whom she has five children; only one of them lives with them now. She inherited the house where they live in the town of Pueblo Nuevo from her parents 24 years ago. From the time she was a little girl, she learned how to take care of the land: "I was born, grew up, and will die in the country," she says happily. She has had her own agricultural fields for 30 years. She began independently planting potatoes, olluco, peas, and fava beans in large quantities. Together with her husband, she takes care of the fields, fertilizing them and pulling the weeds that grow between the furrows. She still has the help of her youngest son in the sales: "I take my son so he can count the money and help me negotiate," she says. Teodora belongs to the solidarity group "Pueblo Nuevo" and this is her third loan with MFP. She feels good working with her communal bank because she receives advice on improving her plantings, since they are all farmers like Teodora. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments, since they are all responsible. Teodora will invest the requested money in the purchase of 300 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her potato fields.

loans.use: to purchase 300 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her potato fields.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida y continuar progresando en la vida junto a su familia. Anteriormente trabajaba como empleada y los ingresos que allí generaban no estaban siendo suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, es por esto que decidió esforzarse y montar su propio negocio con el que pudiera tener mejores ingresos para sus hijos. Fue así como inició su cibercafé donde ofrece a sus clientes un gran servicio y esto le ha cambiado la vida por completo a ella y sus hijos. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene en su negocio, Rosa busca un préstamo para comprar una impresora que sea más eficiente y poder así prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es tener este negocio muy bien posicionado y que este le brinde la posibilidad de sacar adelante su familia ofreciéndole una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Además, aspira a que en un futuro pueda tener su casa propia y ofrecerle a sus hijos un hogar más estable.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard worker and has managed to overcome great advesity in her life and to keep moving forward in life along with her family. She used to work as a housekeeper but the income she was generating there was not enough to cover her household expenses, so she decided to make an effort and set up her own business in order to have better income for her children. That is how she opened her Internet cafe, where she offers her customers great service. This has completely changed her life, as well as her children's. In order to overcome the problems with capital her business is facing, Rosa is looking for a loan to buy a more efficient printer, so that she can offer her customers better service.

Her dream is to have a very well-established business that will provide her with an opportunity to provide for her family by offering them a better quality of life in the home. Her other aspiration is to own a house in the future so that she can offer her children a more stable home.

loans.use: to purchase a more efficient printer so that she can offer her customers better service.

loans.name: Julieth Carolina

texts.es:
Julieth es una joven madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 7 años de edad, y para poder generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar tiene un negocio de venta de ropa que le ha permitido sostenerse económicamente. A pesar de que no goza de unos grandes recursos económicos, su negocio le ha permitido poco a poco ir superando las grandes dificultades que se le presentan y es por esto que siempre se esfuerza para hacerlo crecer y que este le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital en su negocio, Julieth busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa y así responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder tener mejores ingresos para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Julieth is a young single mother who is the head of household of her 7 year old son.  To generate the income required to sustain the expenses of her household, she has a business selling clothes that has allowed her to support themselves. 

In spite of not having large financial resources, her business has allowed her to slowly overcome the great difficulties she faces.  That is why she always strives to grow her finances and this could improve the quality of life of her home. Seeking to overcome the difficulty of capital in your business, Julieth is seeking a loan to buy an assortment of clothing and thus respond to large orders from customers.

Her dream is to have better income to provide a better quality of life and access to better education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing and thus respond to large customer orders.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is from Iraq.  He is 29 years old, single and lives with his family of four.  He is the only provider for the family.

Wissam owns a men's clothing shop.  He specializes in men’s cloaks.  He established his business in 2010, and has gained experience in the field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 Youth Loan to pay his annual rent and increase his inventory.  He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay rent and increase inventory in his clothing shop.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Mangles Group

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 28 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su pequeño hijo y su esposo quien también es comerciante y la respalda en el crecimiento de su actividad como también en sus responsabilidades, Sandra este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años en la comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto muy estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es muy grande ya que esta en el centro de su comunidad por la calle principal, y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Sandra el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, cal, leña, sartén, etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas crezcan mucho, ya que comprara mucho producto para contrarrestar la demanda diaria de sus clientes, los cuales visitan su negocio desde muy temprano de la mañana.
los planes a futuro de Sandra es seguir creciendo en su actividad , como también comprar una maquina de hacer tortillas, al mismo tiempo generarse mejores ingresos , y darle una buena educación a su hijo como también tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
Sandra es la cordinadora de Grupo Solidario Los Mangles y sus compañeros son:
Teresa se dedica a la venta de golosinas y también tiene una chiclera.
Digna se dedica a la venta de tortillas
Fidelina se dedica a la venta de tortillas y también a la venta de ropa usada.
Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old and lives in the south of Honduras with her small son and her husband, who also is a vendor.  He supports her in the growth of her business as well as in her responsibilities.  Sandra has had this business for five years in the community where she lives.  Her business is located in a strategic spot where there's a steady stream of people because it's near the main street in the center of her community, which makes it a busy place.

Sandra needs the loan to buy corn, lime, firewood, a frying pan, etc.  The desired impact of the financing is for her sales to grow a lot because she's going to buy a lot of products to meet the daily demand from her customers, who visit her business starting very early in the morning.

Sandra's future plans are to continue growing in her business and buy a tortilla-making machine to generate better income, give her son a better education, and have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

Sandra is the coordinator of the Solidarity Group Los Mangles and her group members are:

Teresa sells candy and gum.  Digna sells tortillas.  Fidelina sells tortillas and also used clothing.

Choluteca, Honduras–July 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
MARTHA ES UNA MUJER SEPARADA, TIENE UNA HIJA DE 12 AÑOS QUE ACTUALMENTE CURSA EL NIVEL SECUNDARIA. DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS SE A ESFORZADO POR SACAR ADELANTE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO CON ESPECIALIDAD EN COMIDA RAPIDA COMO LO ES EN LA VENTA DE HAMBURGUESAS Y BURRITOS. 

ELLA VE LA NECESIDAD DE MEJORAR SUS VENTAS, POR LO CUAL RECURRE A LA SOLICITUD DE UN PRESTAMO EL CUAL LE BRINDE LA PORTUNIDAD DE REALIZAR COMPRAS A MAYOR VOLUMEN DE LOS MATERIALES E INGREDIENTES QUE ELLA UTILIZA Y DE NUEVOS MATERIALES CON EL PROPOSITO DE EXTENDER SU NEGOCIO A UN MAYOR NUMERO DE CLIENTES, A LOS CUALES LES PUEDA OFRECER VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS DE COMIDA Y UN MEJOR SERVICIO.
texts.en:
Martha is separated and has a 12-year-old daughter currently attending secondary school. She sells hamburgers and burritos.

Martha sees the need to increase sales and is asking for a loan in order to have the opportunity to buy materials and ingredients in bulk.  She will use this opportunity to extend her business to a greater number of clients, in order to offer a wider variety of products and a better service to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
La señora Valeria, es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito coronel portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de catálogo y recién  lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y espera que le sigan apoyando para que pueda seguir creciendo su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: los productos que están de oferta para poder tener en stock y venderlo en su precio real,  2 cremas para el cuerpo, 3 lápiz labiales, 2 enjuagues, 2 cremas para el rostro anti edad, 2 colonias para hombres, 2 talcos para pies. 
Para ayudar a su esposo económicamente tiene que trabajar , no será bastante pero lo necesario para poder cubrir algunos gastos extras de la casa, gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido comprar algunas cosas para su hogar.
texts.en:
Valeria’s a member of the “Mujeres De Éxito” (Women of Success) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 26-years-old, married and has a son.

She sells products via catalogue and has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for just two years.  She hopes they will continue supporting her so that she can continue growing in her business.

She will use her new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy products that are on sale to have in stock and then sell at regular price: two body creams, three lipsticks, 2 rinses, 2 anti-aging face creams, 2 men’s colognes and 2 foot powders.

In order to help her husband economically she has to work.  It may not be much but it’s enough to cover some of the extra household expenses.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she’s been able to buy some things for her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: Lelis con su credikiva surtió sus negocios, comprando cervezas y mercancía variada como jeans, perfumes y cosméticos. Ella está muy satisfecha porque adicionó otro capital de trabajo a su negocio que le permitió aumentar sus ventas y mejorar el surtido de productos. En la actualidad se prepara para aplicar a un nuevo credikiva con el cual invertirá una vez más en refrescos y cervezas y además mercancía sobre pedidos, que han hecho sus clientes especialmente en la línea de ropa femenina y masculina. Su inversión planea tener éxito por su experiencia y porque su local está ubicado en un lugar de gran potencial de la clientela que ella ha señalado como importante para promocionar y vender sus productos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos por el apoyo,  porque así puedo ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos. “
texts.en: Lelis used her Kiva loan to stock her businesses buying beer and assorted merchandise like jeans, perfume and cosmetics.  She’s very satisfied because she added more working capital that allowed her to increase sales and improve the variety of her stock.  She is currently preparing to apply for a new Kiva loan that she will once again use to buy soft-drinks, beer and more merchandise to fill orders her customers have placed especially clothes for women and men.  Her investment augurs success because of her experience and because her locale is in a place with a large potential clientele that she’s identifies as important to promote and sell her wares to.  Her message to Kiva lenders is: “My thanks for the support because I’m able to offer my children a better quality of life this way.”

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, beer and clothes for women and men.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо родилась 1962 году в Турсунзаде. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Зулайхо имеет среднее образование. Она более тридцати лет занимается растениеводством. На сегодняшний день Зулайхо в основном выращивает овощи (огурцы и помидоры). Она просит кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений с целью получения хорошего урожая.
texts.en: Zulaykho was born in 1962 in Tursun-zoda.  She is married and has one child.  Zulaykho has a secondary education.  She has been involved in agriculture for over thirty years.  Today, Zulaykho primarily grows vegetables (cucumbers and tomatoes).  She is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married and has one child who is in class three.  Since the income generated by her husband in insufficient to cover all household expenses, she decided to find a way to contribute economically to her home and provide a better quality of life for her child.

She used some savings, and much effort, to open a food stall at home where she sells basic staples to her customers.  In addition, she sells firewood and charcoal.  Getting ahead with her businesses has been very difficult because of the little capital she has, which is why she is looking for a loan to buy wheat flour, sacks of charcoal, and firewood.

With the loan, she will be able to gradually stock her store so that her customers can get good service there.  Her greatest dream is to succeed with the store so that, thanks to it, she can continue offering her family a better quality of life and better opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy items for her food stall.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga de 51 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y un hijo en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de la finca San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace ya varios años a la venta de abarrotería, refrescos, ropa para niños  adultos.
Doña Olga esta solicitando este prestamo para compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, jugos, agua, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, pollo, papel higiénico, huevos y otros productos de consumo, con el apoyo de este préstamo Doña Olga mejorara su negocio y tendrá mejores utilidades.
Doña Olga tiene sus metas a corto plazo de hacer crecer su negocio y su sueño es seguir trabajando para  mejorar su casa para su bienestar y el de su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Olga is fifty-one years old, married, and lives with her husband and son in a house located in the vicinity of the farm San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has made her living for many years selling groceries, sodas, and clothing for children and adults.

Olga is requesting this loan to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, butter, sodas, juices, water, dairy products, sausages, meats, chicken, toilet paper, eggs, and other consumables. With the support of this loan Olga will improve her business and will have better utilities.

Olga's short-term goal is to grow her business and her dream is to continue working to improve her house both for her well-being and that of her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  July 2012.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, butter, sodas, juices, water, dairy products, sausages, meats, chicken, toilet paper, eggs, and other consumables for her business.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, ha decidido montar su propio negocio con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda contribuir económicamente en su hogar para tener una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad de la preparación y venta de fritos la aprendió empíricamente y ahora gracias a esta su familia puede gozar de un mejor bienestar. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, Diana busca ahora un préstamo para comprar unas mesas y sillas y una carpa para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar y sacar este negocio adelante para que en un futuro le permita acceder a su hijo a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Diana’s married and has a 12-year-old son.  Because her husband’s income is insufficient to cover all household expenses, she decided to open her own business aiming at generating income to contribute economically to her home and have a better quality of life.  

Her activity is making fried fast-food snacks that she learned how to do empirically and now thanks to this her family is able to enjoy improved wellbeing.  Because she started the business with little capital, Diana is now looking for a loan to buy some tables, chairs and a tent to provide better service to her customers.

Her dream is to have better quality of life at home and to move the business forward so that in the future her son will be able to access a university education.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a tent.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.ru: Cадафу 49 лет. Она прекрасная мать и любимая жена. Она занимается животноводством с детства, так как она в отцовском доме помогала маме и папе.  После замужества она продолжала этот вид бизнеса с мужем, муж тоже трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Садаф каждый день с утра продаёт молоко соседям, соседи довольны от Садафа за то что, она продаёт экологический чистый продукт. В ООО МЗО «Имон-Интернешнл» она обращается повторно. Садаф запрашивает 14000 сомони для  капитального ремонта и достройки нового  дома, который уже стоит два года недостроенным. Садаф планирует погасить кредит за счет прибыли своего бизнеса и регулярного  денежного перевода сына, который устроился на хорошую работу в Российской Федерации. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sadaf is 49 years old.  She is a beautiful mother and a loving wife.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since childhood because she helped her mother and father in the father's home.  After marriage, she continued this type of business with her husband, who is also a hardworking and kind person.  Sadaf sells milk to her neighbors since morning every day, and the neighbors are happy with her because she sells an ecologically clean product.  This is not Sadaf's first time coming to "Imon-International."  She is requesting 14000 somoni to make major repairs and build a new house, which has been unfinished for two years.  Sadaf plans to repay the loan with the profit from her business and regular money transfers from her son, who got a good job in the Russian Federation.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials as wood, brick, cement for building a new house

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is a 61-year-old, married woman and the mother of seven grownup children from Bohol, Philippines.  She has run a sari-sari (convenience store) for more than six years.  She sells canned goods, noodles, bread and snack foods to the people in her neighborhood.  This is the source of her income.

Leliosa does her best to earn a living.  As of this time, she needs more funding for her business to grow.  Leliosa is requesting a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as canned goods, snack foods and soda.  With it, she can attract and cater to more customers because she will have more items in her store. 

Leliosa hopes to expand her business and generate more income to be used for their daily needs.  Any additional revenue will be reinvested into the same business or used for savings.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chaka

texts.en:
Chaka is the father of two children and has been actively farming for 4 successive years at his rural home in Mwambalazi. 

Chaka has requested a loan of 30,000 KES (being his second loan) from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy dairy goats. He says he wants to raise dairy goats because of their high nutritional milk and resistance to harsh weather conditions. Chaka hopes to raise more income to pay for his children's education. He also plans to install an irrigation system on his farm to mitigate the challenge of low rainfall.

He appreciates Yehu Microfinance's loan services which have enabled him to acquire more assets for his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 35-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She spends her time in her clothing store. Dorothy is a hard-working woman, who is liked by almost all of her customers that come to her store in order to enjoy communicating with her and enjoy her services.

Dorothy is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Yehu, in order to buy bales of clothes to restock her store. She believes that her work has helped her a lot in filling her free time, and encouraging her to have new friends most of the time. Dorothy is happy with what she has accomplished till now. She has been in this business for the last 2 years.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes to restock her store.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa, 27, has been married to Juliet for 5 years. They have one child that still depends on them.

Musa has had his bookstore for the last 5 years. He has a very good clientele and gets help from his wife. Together, they run the business. His wife is a businesswoman and they are both able to get ahead this way helping each other out.

He’s asking for this loan to buy bundles of books, pencils and rulers to be able to offer variety to his customers, thus improving his income.

loans.use: to buy bundles of books, pencils and rulers

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las marias esta conformado por 10 integrantes las cuales son: Alma Lizeth, Maria Angelica, Jose Maria, Maria Ines, Petrona Jannette, Maria Maribel, Paz Julia, Raquel Cristina, Donald Antonio, Mauda Jose. Todas son personas  emprendedores, trabajadores, Luchadores , con ganas de superacion personal, Maria Angelica es la cordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la buena coordinación de las integrantes del banco. Maria Angelica tiene por actividad economica la venta de ropa usada la cual consisten en la compra de pacas de ropa de niños y adultos.
texts.en:
The “Las Marías” communal bank has 10 members: Alma Lizeth, María Angélica, José María, Eugenia Estela, María Inés, Petrona Jannette, María Maribel, Paz Julia, Raquel Cristina, Donald Antonio and Mauda José.  They are all hard-working, enterprising, and tenacious who very much want to get ahead.  

María Angélica is the communal bank coordinator; she’s in charge of the good coordination among bank members.  María Angélica’s economic activity is selling used clothes; she buys large bundles of children’s and adults’ clothes.

loans.use: to buy bundles of children and adult clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy florist supplies.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Él tiene un excelente conocimiento sobre brindar seguridad privada desde hace 14 años y lo aprendió de su padre. 

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para construir una pared para dividir la cocina. Así, dispondrá de un mejor espacio para la preparación de los alimentos. Esto lo hace con el objetivo de que su familia tenga una estabilidad, seguridad contra la delincuencia, debido a que solo vive junto con su esposa e hijos. Don Juan tiene el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos proporcionándoles educación para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Don Juan, 42, lives with his wife and two children.  He knows the private security business inside and out, a business that he learned from his father and has practiced for 14 years. 

He will use this Fundacion Campo loan to build a dividing wall in his kitchen.  The investment will provide a better space for making meals.  His goal is to provide his family with a safer place to live, secure from crime.  Don Juan's goal is to improve his family's quality of life and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to build an internal wall.

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que estaba generando su esposo no estaban siendo suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio y esforzarse para generar ingresos que puedan contribuir a mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar. Hace 3 años que montó su negocio el cual es una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar a sus clientes y gracias a este ha logrado contribuir económicamente para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A pesar de que siguen teniendo dificultades económicas y las han ido superando poco a poco, su esfuerzo ha permitido obtener una mejor calidad de vida en su familia. Buscando ofrecer un mejor servicio para sus clientes, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda con productos que ya se han ido agotando.

Su mayor sueño es poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y brindarle a su hija el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has a 14 year old daughter.  Because of the income that her husband was generating, there wasn't enough money to cover the household expenses, so she decided to start her own business and make the effort to have more income to contribute to improving their quality of life.  She started her business 3 years ago and set up a general store where she offers household products to her customers and this has helped improve their living standards.  Although she has continued having economic difficulties, they have been getting through them little by little and her efforts have allowed them to have a better family life.  Wanting to offer her customers better service, Maria is looking for a loan to buy home products and to supply her store with items that are running out.

Her big dream is to offer her family a better quality of life and to offer her daughter access to a higher education at the university in the future.

loans.use: to buy home products and to supply her store with items that are running out.

loans.name: Amada De Jesus

texts.es:
Amada es una persona muy trabajadora y también siempre se le ha reconocido por ser muy solidaria, y gracias a esto ha venido saliendo adelante a pesar de las grandes dificultades que se le han presentado y las dificultades que tiene su familia. Madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos, Amada también tiene 2 hermanas que padecen de dificultades mentales, por esto con su negocio además de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, contribuye económicamente para que sus hermanas puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Desde que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó y la dejó a cargo de todo el sostenimiento de su hogar, Amada ha venido trabajando fuertemente en un negocio que ya tenía que era la crianza de pollos y venta de huevos, y gracias a su esfuerzo su familia ha podido salir adelante superando las dificultades. Gracias a que últimamente ha tenido muy buenas ventas, pero debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, Amada busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas ponedoras y comprar el cuido con que las alimenta.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus ingresos para contribuir aún más a sus hermanas para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Además aspira a que sus hijos también tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida y puedan tener en su hogar mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amada is a very hardworking woman who has always been notable for being very supportive.  Thanks to this she’s been getting ahead despite the great difficulties that have arisen and the difficulties her family has.  

She’s a single mother head of household.  She has two children but also has two sisters who have mental health problems.  Because of this, with her business besides generating income to support her home, she contributes economically so that her sisters can have better quality of life.  Since the father of her children abandoned them leaving the entire support of her household in her hands, Amada has been working hard in a business she already had which was raising chickens and selling eggs.  Thanks to her efforts, her family has been able to get ahead overcoming all the difficulties.  

Thanks to her sales being very good lately but because she does not have much capital, Amada is looking for a loan to buy more laying hens and the feed for them.  Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her income to contribute still more so that her sisters can have better quality of life.  She also hopes her children will have better opportunities in life and be able to have better quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy more laying hens and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия уже второй раз получает кредит в нашей организации. Первый кредит она получила для повторного посева урожая пшеницы. Зулфия улучшила жизненные условия. На сегодняшний день она продолжает свою деятельность. Зулфия занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает огурцы. 
Зулфия просит кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений с целью получения высококачественного урожая.
texts.en: This is Zulfiya's second time obtaining a loan from our organization.  She received her first loan to sow wheat.  Zulfiya improved her living conditions.  Today, she continues her business.  Zulfiya is involved in agriculture.  She grows cucumbers.  Zulfiya is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to get a high-quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура – 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Занимается торговлей женской одежды и обуви. Опыт в этой деятельности около 10 лет. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2011 г. Этот кредит 3 по счету. На полученный кредит планирует увеличить свой товарооборот, закупить сезонный товар. Увеличив свой товарооборот она хочет откладывать деньги на будущее своих детей. Муж Манзуры тоже помогает ей вести хозяйство и воспитывать детей. Манзура выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Manzura is 42 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in selling women's clothing and shoes.  She has about ten years of experience in this business.  Manzura has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2011.  This is her third loan.  She plans to use this loan to increase her goods turnover and purchase seasonal merchandise.  After increasing her goods turnover, she wants to save money for her children's future.  Manzura's husband also helps her with running the household and raising the children.  Manzura expresses her gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and lives in Mayors Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Ozamiz City. Corazon is married with three children. She has been a member of PMPC for 18 years. She has a general store business that sells a variety of products such as toothpaste, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Corazon hopes that with the help of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, she can finish her house and improve their living.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: Shahodat is 34 years old.  She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a rich business lady.  Her life partner’s name is Shuhrat, and they have a little child.  She is one of the successful business women in her town.  For more than five years, she has been busy selling food items such as cake, biscuits and coffee.  She knows all aspects of her business very well.  Her experiences and skills help her develop the business and, therefore, improve her living condition.  She manages the business alone.  She is asking for a loan to buy food items to widen her assortment.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for her shop.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is a 50-year-old married woman who owns and manages a rice farming business to support her family. She has been doing this since she was a teenage girl with her parents. She permanently lives with her spouse and 6 children in a thatched house situated in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province while her married child lives separately with his new family. Most of her children quit studying and started working in various careers to help their parents financially. Only her last-born child is still attending school and Yem plans to provide him a high education.

Yem’s husband is an operator of transportation services in their neighborhood. He owns an old motorcycle in providing this type of service. Unfortunately, his motorcycle has mechanical problems, which results negatively in his revenues. With regard to this situation, Yem decided to take out a loan of 1,400 USD to purchase a new motorcycle to support her husband’s transportation business. She surely believes that she and her husband will be able to sustain their businesses and make a consistent income for their living’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to support her husband’s transportation business.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en: Farhod is married to a beautiful woman by the name of Husniya. They have 3 children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. He is one of the successful businessmen in his town. For more than 3 years, he has been busy with driving. Thanks to the good service, he has managed to gain many customers. But recently, his car has a bad condition and Farhod must repair it. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to repair his car. In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which allows him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells cooked rice, banku (maize and cassava dough), and palm kernel oil in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, Ghana.  She is a widow with five grown children.  Ama has been selling cooked rice, banku, and palm kernel oil for about 30 years.  She is responsible for paying her household and living expenses and helping pay her grandchildren's school fees.  Her loan will be used to buy palm kernel oil and raw rice in bulk.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to support herself.

loans.use: to buy palm kernel oil and raw rice in bulk.

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
Jhon Fredy siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a esta cualidad y superar las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Casado y padre de 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, Jhon Fredy trabaja anteriormente como operario en una empresa de confecciones, y gracias a su experiencia, un día decidió retirarse de su trabajo y comenzar su propio negocio en busca de progresar económicamente y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Fue así como comenzó con su taller de confección donde cuenta con la maquinaria básica, pero gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ahora tiene grandes clientes que le permiten salir adelante. Debido a que sus pedidos superan su capacidad de producción, Jhon Fredy busca un préstamo para comprar una cortadora que le permita agilizar su producción para cumplir con los pedidos y ampliar sus ventas.

Su sueño es que su taller de confección salga adelante y su esposa y sus 2 hijos tengan mejores oportunidades, además de que pueda generar empleo en su taller y este brinde estabilidad para muchas más familias.
texts.en:
Jhon Fredy has always been a hardworking person who has managed to get ahead and overcome the great adversities life has thrust at him thanks to this quality.  He’s married and father of two children who are 12 and 6 years of age.  Jhon Fredy used to work as an employee in a sewing firm and thanks to his experience one day decided to leave his job and start his own business seeking to progress economically and provide his family with better quality of life.

This is how he started his sewing workshop where he has basic machinery but thanks to the good quality of his work he has large customers that make it possible for him to get ahead.  

Because his orders surpass his production capacity, Jhon Fredy is looking for a loan to buy a fabric cutting machine that will make work less time consuming so that he can meet his orders and increase sales.

His dream for his sewing shop is that it moves forward so that his wife and two children will have better opportunities in addition to its generating employment providing many more families with stability.

loans.use: to buy a fabric cutting machine.

loans.name: Maria Custodia

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos a quienes les busca brindar el acceso a una educación de buena calidad, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, inició desde hace un tiempo su propio negocio de cría de cerdos, pues gracias a que sus padres se dedicaron siempre a las actividades del campo, ha aprendido la actividad cuando trabajaba junto a ellos. Desde que montó su negocio las condiciones económicas de su hogar, y la calidad de vida de sus 4 hijos y su esposo han mejorado considerablemente; es por esto que todos los días se sigue esforzando para que su negocio les permita salir adelante y generar mejores ingresos para tener mejores oportunidades en su hogar. Debido a que tiene unos pedidos de cerdos que no logra satisfacer con las existencias que tiene, Maria busca un préstamo que le permita comprar cerdos y el concentrado para su alimentación.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio siga saliendo adelante y le permita brindarles a sus 4 hijos el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has four children. She is trying to provide them with access to a good-quality education. Because her husband's income is not enough to sustain the household, Maria started her own business some time ago: she raises hogs. Thanks to the fact that her parents always worked in agriculture, she learned this work while working with them. Since she opened her own business, her household economy and her four children's quality of life, as well as that of her husband, have improved considerably. For this reason, she works very hard every day so that her business will get them ahead and generate more income and more opportunities for her household. Because she has some orders for hogs which she will not be able to fill with her current stock, Maria is looking for a loan which will allow her to buy hogs and the concentrate to feed them.
Her greatest dream is for her business to continue moving forward and allowing her to offer her four children access to a higher-quality education and, in the future, access to a university education.

loans.use: to buy hogs and concentrate for feeding them.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru:
Нургул 33 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей, двое из которых в дошкольном возрасте. В 2009 году в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Нургул начала свой бизнес в торговле продовольственными товарами  в небольшом магазине. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Нургуль сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  20,000 сом (KGS). Успешное развитие бизнеса подтолкнуло семью к новым идеям – и вторая комнатка в магазине была оборудована под парикмахерскую, которая стала небольшим бизнесом для мужа Нургул. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нургул обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента за счет закупа партий  чая, масла и сахара, который будет приобретаться местным населением в большом количестве для изготовления джемов и варенья на зимний период.  Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места, а летом-  отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Nurgul is 33 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are of preschool age.  In search of a source of income for the family, she started her own business in selling food products at a small store in 2009.  Thanks to persistence and hard work, Nurgul was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  Successful business development prompted the family to explore new ideas, and the second room in the store was remodeled to become a barbershop and a small business for Nurgul's husband.  In order to further develop her business, Nurgul requested a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise selection by buying an inventory of tea, butter and sugar, which will be bought by local residents in large quantities to make jams and preserves for the winter period.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into an expansion of her retail space and repairing her house in the summer.

loans.use: to expand product selection

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of agricultural products.  She has worked in this business for more than 20 years, so she already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from her.

Her husband works in livestock, buying and selling small animals, and in this way, they help each other to get ahead.  Mwanasha is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy plants, vegetables and supplies to stock her business and offer good quality to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, she previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Murhula/miti Group

texts.fr: Namuke est présidente de l’association d’affaire  Murhula/Miti.  Agée de 41 ans est veuve avec 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés. Le credit sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 4chevres  qu’elle pourra revendre à plus de 100km du village de kavumu. Elle remercie Hekima pour l’avoir soutenu et compte devenir fournisseur des chèvres dans son village.
texts.en:
Namuke is the president of the business association Murhula/Miti.  She is 41 years old and a widow, and she has four children, of whom three are in school. The loan requested is going to enable her to purchase four goats that she will be able to resell over 100 km from the village of Kavumu. 

She thanks Hekima for having supported her, and she plans to become a supplier of goats in her village.

loans.use: to buy four goats to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various merchandise for sale such as shoes, clothing, livestock and jewelry

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette and her family are artisans who specialize in making chess sets and sculptures carved from natural stone. To continue production they would like to purchase such raw materials as marble, onyx, and resins.

Odette has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I am from the beautiful Mexican state of Puebla. My father, Edgar, first opened the family workshop 30 years ago. Our town is renowned throughout Mexico for its carvings in onyx and marble. Raised in this artistic heritage, we began crafting tables and other items in onyx and marble. The art of sculpting marble and onyx demands patience and dedication, both of which have been cultivated over time in the family workshop."

"Thank you for taking part in this interest-free microcredit loan, because economic factors play a big role in our work. I am certain that your support will help us grow."

Use the link below to view the hand-carved stone items made by Odette and her family on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2344

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as marble, onyx, and resins

loans.name: Higinio Hernandez

texts.en:
Higinio is an artisan from Mexico's Huichol community who specializes in traditional beadwork art. To continue production, he would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of beads, as well as in molds to make his masks. Higinio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was born in the Jalisco mountains of Mexico, in a Huichol village. I have followed in the family tradition of beaded artwork. I make my masks over paper-mache forms, and my wife and I place the beads on the masks one-by-one on an adhesive coating of beeswax. The designs are completely improvised and are inspired by our reflections and feelings at the moment that we're working. I hope that through them people will get a better understanding of the magic and meaning of the Huichol culture.

"Thank you for offering me the opportunity of this interest-free microcredit loan, because it means we can keep doing what we love to do. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Higinio's beadwork masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1547

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of beads, as well as in molds to make his masks.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.en:
Alonso is an artisan who creates handcrafted Talavera ceramics, which are produced only in and around the Mexican city of Puebla. He needs to hire additional assistants for his workshop, so he can increase production for the holiday season.

Alonso has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I come from Puebla and I create traditional majolica ceramics in the Talavera style. Our work is carried out the way it's been done here for hundreds of years. I am concerned about the environment, its conservation and its rescue. This is reflected in our ceramics, as everything we make is lead free. Talavera was brought to Mexico by artisans from Talavera de la Reina, Spain, where it was already influenced by Moorish designs. True Talavera requires a rigorous procedure and is produced only in Puebla."

"I appreciate the opportunities that will be created by this microcredit loan. You inspire me to keep moving ahead with my traditional craft. Thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Alonso's Talavera ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4361

loans.use: to hire additional assistants for his workshop, so he can increase production for the holiday season

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежде 35 лет, замужем, имеет дочь – школьницу. В 2007 году в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Надежда начала свой бизнес в  животноводстве с начальной суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Надежда сумела развить свой бизнес, насчитывающий на сегодня 3 головы крупного рогатого скота  с ежемесячным доходом  20,000 сом (KGS). Также, Надежда занимается пошивом и реставрацией одежды на дому, служащий небольшим доходом в бюджет семьи.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надежда обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Надежда  планирует вложить в  расширение бизнеса и реконструкцию своего дома.
texts.en: Nadezhda is 35 years old, married and has a daughter of school age.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2007 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, Nadezhda was able to develop her business to contain three cows today and have a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  Also, Nadezhda is involved in sewing and repairing clothing at home and provides a small income for the family budget.  In order to further develop her business, Nadezhda requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into an expansion of her business and remodel of her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
Saddam is 22 years-old from Gaza.  He is married and lives with his wife and a baby girl.

He asked Kiva partner Ryada for this start-up loan in order to buy shelves, refrigerators,  an electrical generator, and a glass door for his new grocery store.
He hopes that this will increase the goods diplayed and thus improve his income.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises and not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy shelves, refrigerators, an electrical generator, and a glass door for his grocery store.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
This is Emiliana, she previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and pay maintenance for their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan in order to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance for their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and pay for educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emiliana dreams that her business will grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Herikwetu/katana Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Mapendo est trésorière dans le groupe Herikwetu. Elle est âgée de 40ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés.  Avec le prêt sollicité, elle pourra acheter 25 bidons d’huile de palme. Son rêve est  d’avoir son propre dépôt de stockage pour la vente en gros et une bonne survie de ses enfants. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en: This client, Mapendo, is the treasurer of the group Herikwetu. She is 40 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children, of whom three are in school. With the loan requested, she will be able to purchase 25 containers of palm oil. Her dream is to have her own warehouse for inventory to sell wholesale and also to provide a good life for her children. So she thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to purchase 25 containers of palm oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bakina

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bazins, tissus depuis 2000, Madame Bakina vit avec son mari chauffeur et ses trois enfants dont 01 scolarisé à Lomé. Elle sollicite dans notre institution un premier prêt pour s’acheter des marchandises. Elle veut augmenter son fonds de commerce et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille. Elle est âgée de 24ans.
texts.en: A retail of damask fabrics and cloth since 2000, Ms. Bakina lives with her husband, a driver, and her three children, of whom one is in school in Lomé. She is requesting an initial loan from our institution to purchase some merchandise. She wants to increase her business fund and to ensure her family thrives. She is 24 years old.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and some damasks

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela es casada y en su hogar vive su mamá y es una fortuna tenerla ya que ella es un apersona de edad muy avanzada y requiere de muchos cuidados. A ella le están ofreciendo unas pacas de ropa mixta a un muy buen precio por lo cual solicita apoyo porque no tiene el dinero completo y ella comenta que es una buena oportunidad de surtir su venta de ropa. Podrá atraer más clientes ya que la ropa que comprara vendrá para todas las edades y en muy buen estado y así su margen de ganancia será más alto. Ella junto con su esposo se dedican al comercio al ser una personas mayores ya no encontraron buenas oportunidades de trabajo en alguna maquila por lo cual el vender ropa de tianguis en tianguis les ha beneficiado mucho ya que les va muy bien y pueden solventar sus gastos sin tener que pedirle ayuda a sus demás familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs Graciela is married and her mother lives in her home and it's fortunate to have her since she is a person of advanced age and requires a lot of care. She is being offered bundles of assorted clothing at a very good price, which is why she is applying for help because she does not have all the money and she says that it is a very good opportunity to stock her clothing shop.

She will be able to attract more customers since the clothing she will buy will be for all ages and in good condition and that way her profit margin will be higher. Together with her husband they work trading, being older people who can't find good work opportunities in a factory. So selling clothing from market to market has benefited them a lot since it is going well and they can pay their expenses without having to ask for help from the rest of their family.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Accion just made a loan to a start-up green business!  Stephen just opened the doors to his new business Dumping Treasures.  Before starting his own business, Stephen worked for a government run waste management systems for many years.  He saw firsthand how garbage removal companies buried in its depths “treasures”/recyclable products that were worth saving.  Through his experience, Stephen came up with the idea for his new business.  Dumping treasures' mission is to donate and/or recycle whatever is possible from garbage.
