The goal is to minimize their carting load to keep overhead costs at a minimum while still donating and recycling items that people consider trash that for other's may be treasures. The planned operations will be to purchase multiple dumpsters of various sizes. The dumpsters will be homeowner friendly by having the ability to be placed in areas usually not accessible by trucks. The company also plans to service roofers and concrete workers.   Please help us help this creative business get off the ground!

loans.use: to pay for the license required to operate a waste removal company in NYC

loans.name: Sandra Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sandra, se dedica al comercio de ropa, vive con su esposo y un Hijo, el negocio lo inició con unas amigas, trabaja de forma ambulante y no tiene horario establecido para atender el negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse una variedad blusas, faldas, ropa interior, que será la necesaria para poder abastecer el negocio, este préstamo permitirá realizar una buena inversión de mercadería y poder ofrecer a los clientes una mejor calidad.

Su aspiración es tener un negocio bien establecido, que sea más rentable para poder generar mejores ingresos a su familia, también quiere ofrecer a su hijo todo lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Sandra sells clothes. She lives with her husband and son. She started the business while eating chicken with some friends. She works as a street vendor and has no set schedule for the business.

She is asking for the loan to buy a variety of blouses, skirts, and underwear. This is necessary to stock the business. This loan will allow her to make a good nivestment in merchandise to offer her customers better quality.

She aspires to having a stable business and for it to be more profitable to be able to generate better income for her family. She also wants to offer her son everything he needs for his development.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Fort is a vintage furniture retail company, owned and operated by Jacqueline. Fort repairs and redesigns unique pieces of furniture by using recycled materials acquired from estate sales, websites and individual suppliers. Jacqueline has five years of experience in design, craft and repair of procured pieces of furniture and is seeking a $5,000 loan to purchase inventory, a saw machine and to hire an employee to assist her with manufacturing and delivering the furniture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture inventory, equipment (a saw) and to hire an employee

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 25 years-old, sells second hand mobile phones and their spare parts from his rental stall in the phone mart. He started his business five years ago and he already has had some regular customers.  He is divorced from his wife and now lives with his daughter and his mother in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

His family owns an old house which was built many years ago. Since it was built, there has not been any complete renovation to it. In winter, his house has too much heat-loss through its roof.  He uses the coal-fired stove to warm the rooms but this creates harmful smoke in the air all around the city. As we are aware, air pollution is one of the critical and biggest issues in Mongolia and all over the world.  Therefore, he has decided to decrease his usage of the coal and repair his house roof.  He is asking for a loan for iron boards and some other building materials to repair his house roof.

loans.use: To repair his house roof

loans.name: Nantiele

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tubercules et divers dans un marché de la ville de Lomé, madame Nantiele est mariée à un chauffeur. Ils ont 02 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Ils ont 13 et 09ans. Âgée de 34ans, elle s’est lancée depuis 1994 dans cette activité et elle le fait avec plaisir. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des tubercules. Avec le profit, elle veut augmenter le capital, élargir son activité. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut au coté de son mari, assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: A retailer of tubers and various goods at a market in the city of Lomé, Ms. Nantiele is married to a driver. They have two children, 9 and 13 years old, who are both in school. Ms. Nantiele, aged 34, started this business in 1994, and she happily works at it. To bolster her business, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase some tubers. With the profits, she wants to increase her capital and enlarge her business. As for the future, she wants to ensure, along with her husband, her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tubers to sell

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: Agé de 33ans, Mr tété vit avec sa femme revendeuse et ses 02 enfants à Lomé. Le plus jeune âgé de 03ans ne va pas encore à l’école. Seul l’ainé  de 06ans est scolarisé. En 2002, il s’est donné à la vente de pomme de terre, d’ail et oignon dans un marché de la place.  Son premier crédit qu’il sollicite dans notre institution lui servira à s’approvisionner en pomme de terre, ailes et oignons. Il compte réinvestir ses profits dans l'entreprise et espère a long terme assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Tété, aged 33, lives with his wife, a retailer, and his two children in Lomé. The youngest is 3 years old and not yet in school. Only the oldest, aged 6, is in school. In 2002, Mr. Tété devoted himself to selling potatoes, garlic, and onions at a local market. His first loan he is requesting from our institution will serve to supply him with potatoes, garlic, and onions. He plans to reinvest his profits into his enterprise and hopes to ensure a better future for his family in the long term.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, and garlic

loans.name: Apollinaire

texts.fr: Revendeur de friperie dans un marché de la place, Mr Apollinaire âgé de 44ans est marié à une revendeuse et ils ont un enfant de 08ans qui va à l’école. Il vend des chemises blanches, des corsages pour dames. Il est exposé à la concurrence sur le terrain et afin de garder ses clients, il sollicite l’aide de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en habits. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, la faire développer et permettre à sa famille de mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en:
A retailer of secondhand clothing at a local market, Mr. Apollinaire, aged 44, is married to a retailer, and they have one child, aged 8, who goes to school. Mr. Apollinaire sells white shirts and blouses for women. 

He is exposed to actual competition, and to keep his customers, he is requesting aid from WAGES to stock up on clothing. He wants to reinvest in his business, develop it, and enable his family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Behxhet

texts.en:
Behxhet is a 44-year-old married man from Kosovo with one daughter. He is very hard-working man. He mows agricultural lands, continuing his family business tradition. In order for him to complete this work, he needs to use a tractor, which currently is need of repair.

Behxhet is requesting this loan so that he is be able to repair the tractor and improve the efficiency of his business. Doing so would allow him to expand his business, gaining more customers and therefore increasing his income for his family. He hopes to be able to eventually buy more agricultural machines and improve the life of his family. He is very thankful for this help!

loans.use: To repair his tractor

loans.name: Gabriel Alberto

texts.es:
Gabriel aprendió desde la edad de 11 años la actividad de la mecánica, pues en su hogar tenían grandes dificultades económicas y desde esa edad le toco comenzar a trabajar para apoyar el sustento familiar. Gracias a toda la experiencia que ha adquirido ahora es muy reconocido por la buena calidad de su trabajo, y esto le ha permitido venir creciendo en su taller de mecánica. Gabriel se encuentra separado de la madre de sus 2 hijos y sus 2 hijos se encuentran a cargo suyo, por esto ha presentado algunas dificultades económicas que viene superando poco a poco con el gran esfuerzo que hace en su trabajo. Debido a que se le dañó el compresor, una de las principales herramientas en su taller, ha venido acumulando una gran cantidad de pedidos de sus clientes, por esto busca un préstamo para comprar un compresor y reemplazar el averiado y continuar prestando un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este taller de mecánica adelante y que le siga brindando las posibilidades económicas para salir adelante, además de poder brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos y permitirles acceder a una buena educación.
texts.en:
Gabriel learned how to be a mechanic when he was 11 years old, since his household endured great financial problems and at that age he had to begin working to help support his family. Thanks to all the experience he has acquired, his work is now very well known for its fine quality and this has enabled him to continue expanding his mechanic’s workshop. 

Gabriel is separated from the mother of his two children and he has been the one taking care of them. Thus he has encountered several financial problems which, through hard work, he has gradually been able to overcome. Since one of the principal tools in his workshop, his compressor, was damaged, a large number of jobs from his customers has been accumulating. Thus he is looking for a loan to purchase a compressor and replace the damaged one, so he can continue providing good service to his clients.

His dream is to move this mechanic’s workshop forward so that it can continue providing the economic means for him to succeed. As well he will be able to provide a good quality of life to his two children and enable them to have access to a good education

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and replace the damaged one so he can continue providing good service to his customers.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom is a rice farmer living in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been engaged in this type of business for over 10 years, and it has become the major source of her family’s income. Yom is married to an industrious man who works in the construction industry to provide the family an income. Together, they have two children who are attending school and in need of daily allowances.

Yom would like to maintain good growth of her business and make it more feasible, which is why she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay labor costs incurred in transplanting rice and to purchase bags of fertilizer to apply on her crops. She always dreams of sending her children to a good college after the high school level. This encourages her to work harder to make improvements in her business in order to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to pay labor costs incurred in transplanting rice and to purchase fertilizer to apply on her crops.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía es una joven emprendedora que desde muy joven comenzó vendiendo dulces en el colegio para generar sus ingresos y apoyar en su hogar a su madre que es madre soltera cabeza de familia de Estefanía y su hermana menor. Luego, cuando se graduó de su colegio, en su familia no tenían recursos económicos para que Estefanía pudiera asistir a la universidad, por esto comenzó a vender una gran cantidad de productos que le han permitido generar los ingresos con los que puede pagar su universidad. Actualmente Estefanía tiene 21 años de edad y continúa vendiendo productos de uso personal y calzado a sus clientes, y poco a poco ha venido pagando su universidad para poder salir adelante y apoyar a su familia. Gracias a que tiene muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para satisfacerlos, Estefanía busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal y calzado para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder terminar de pagar su universidad y conseguir un empleo bien remunerado con el que pueda aportar en su hogar económicamente y así su madre y su hermana menor tengan la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Estefanía is an enterprising young woman who, when she was very young, began selling sweets at school to generate some earnings and support her mother, since her mother is a single parent head of household, consisting of Estefanía and her younger sister. Then, when she graduated from school, her family did not have the resources for Estefanía to attend the university. Consequently she began to sell a large quantity of products, which have enabled her to generate an income with which she could pay for her university studies.

Currently Estefanía is 21 years old and continues selling personal use products and footwear to her customers and has gradually been paying her university expenses so she can move ahead and support her family. 

Thanks to the fact that she has many solid orders from her clients, but lacks sufficient capital to fill them, she is looking for a loan that will allow her to purchase personal use products and footwear in order to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products and footwear in order to meet her customers' requests.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 47 years old and lives in Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City. She is married with six children.

Zosima has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 5 years. Zosima requested a loan of 6000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Zosima has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, and beverages.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Thirty-nine year old Luzviminda is a married woman and a mother of six children ages 22, 17, 14, nine, seven and four years old. She and her family live in Bohol, Philippines. Luzviminda has run a convenience store, or sari-sari, for more than 10 years now. This is the source of the family's income. Luzviminda is a hard-working woman who tries her best to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. As of this time, she is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as noodles, canned goods and others. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more customers and augment her income.

Luzviminda dreams of improving her business to generate more revenue so that she will become financially capable of sending her children to school for better learning and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as noodles, canned goods and others

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 3 hijos y para poder generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar tiene un almacén donde vende productos de uso personal y variedades. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una buena calidad de vida; sin embargo, le hecho de tener que responder sola por sus 3 hijos hacen que las dificultades económicas en su hogar persistan, y para esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días con el ánimo de superar estas condiciones. Debido a que tiene ya varios años con este negocio, sus clientes ya la tienen como un referente y esto le ha permitido salir adelante poco a poco y cada vez mejorar sus ventas. Buscando surtir su negocio para la temporada donde sus ventas de incrementan considerablemente, Lourdes busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para la temporada.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de salir adelante gracias a este negocio. Además, aspira a poder superar sus dificultades económicas y lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar junto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother, the head of a family of three children. In order to generate the income that her household needs, she has a store where she sells personal use products and other items. Thanks to this business she has been able to move her children ahead, providing them with a good quality of life. Nevertheless, the fact that she has supported her three children alone has meant that financial problems persist in her household. Consequently she works hard every day with the goal of overcoming these problems.

Since she has spent several years running this business, her customers know her and this has enabled her to move ahead little by little and increasingly improve her sales. Looking to stock her store for the season when sales increase immeasurably, she has sought a loan to purchase personal use products to supply her store for seasonal sales.

Her greatest dream is that her children have the possibility to succeed, thanks to this business. As well, she aspires to be able to overcome her financial difficulties and achieve a better quality of life at home with her children.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products and stock her store for the coming season.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal is 32 years old and lives with his wife named Zolzaya and three children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and two of his children go to the secondary school while his younger son stays at home.

 He started shoe trade business in 2003. Now his business is sustainable and has many regular customers. He is well-experienced in the shoe trade business in his town and local residents appreciate him as a hardworking and diligent man. He is requesting 5,810,000 MNT loan to purchase a hybrid car to carry shoes to the trade center. He said, "I want to expand my business, make more profit and save the money tor my children's higher education."

loans.use: To purchase a hybrid car to carry shoes to the trade center

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
This is Emelia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to cover her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Emelia hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Odbaatar

texts.en:
Mrs. Odbaatar, 43, is one of the skillful and experienced teachers of secondary school in Mongolia. She has been teaching for 23 years nonstop and has  had thousands of pupils in that time. She is always proud of her students. 

Mrs. Odbaatar lives with her two sons and her husband in a small, old house in the ger district of Mongolian, which is comprised of traditional nomadic yurts, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works as a watchman and doesn't earn enough to pay for the family's necessities. Her house was built in the early 1990’s and is not a spacious place to live. In addition to this, Mrs. Odbaatar's house becomes cold and loses heat through the walls in the winter. 

So Mrs. Odbaatar decided to make insulation for the walls and create an extension by adding one more room to her old house. As she said, "My house will be warm and comfortable after the renovation."  She is asking for a loan for the purposes of making wall insulation and the house extension.

loans.use: To make wall insulation and a house extension.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
A hardworking man, Komiljon lives in a house which is in bad condition. He is not married yet. He lives with his parents. With the aim to improve their living conditions, six years ago he began his own business selling children’s clothes. His mother helps him with the business. They work hard but get little income and it is not enough for repairing their house. 

Komiljon is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing their house.  In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy. Please, help him and his family if possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing house

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: This is Ilgar, 44. He is a father to his three children. Ilgar operates a variety store.  He started the business five years ago, and it has allowed him to have a good quality of life in his household and has given him good economic opportunities for progress. To help him continue operations of his business, he is requested a 1000 AZN loan. Ilgar will be utilizing the loan to expand his product inventory. He hopes his business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all his hard work on his business.

loans.use: to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald lives the Changamwe area of Coast province. He is married and has ten children, five of whom are in school. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for two years now. Besides this, Donald also sells firewood.

He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, seasonal weather and high transport and fuel costs.

Donald is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle. The extra income will help him pay for school fees and start an alternative business for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Barika

texts.en:
Barika is 47 years old and lives with her children and husband in a house in the town of Coast Province of Kenya.

Barika has a food selling business, selling in a food stall. She sells a variety of foodstuffs such as dumplings, flat breads, etc. She has gained much business experience in her field.

With her profits earned from the business, she pays the tuition fees of her five children. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I will devote my everything to my family."

She is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to purchase food ingredients such as wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar,beans, etc.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, etc.

loans.name: Srom

texts.en:
Srom is 33 years old and a married woman who has been residing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is responsible for three school-aged children who are under her care and support. Srom works as a garment worker in Phnom Penh. She has skills in sewing parts of clothes, normally earning an average of 3.00 USD per day, estimated by the credit officer. But sometimes, she works overtime upon request, so she can yield more income. However, Srom’s husband is the main income provider of the family. He works in the construction industry, providing house construction services around the country with his team.


With the loan requested, Srom would like to purchase construction supplies and tools for her husband, so that he will be able to make his business more viable and have more customers.

Someday, Srom hopes that she can achieve economic stability and send all her children to attend a university program.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and tools for her husband offering his construction service.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a 39-year-old carpenter and farmer. He lives in Bohol, Philippines, together with his family and four young children. Nilo is raising hogs at the same time. These are the sources of his income. 

Nilo is in need of additional capital for his business. He is requesting a loan worth 4000 PHP to buy feed for the pigs that he is raising. With the loan, Nilo will be able to produce healthy pigs, thus giving him chance of augmenting his income. 

Nilo dreams of expanding his business and making it a success. He believes that it takes hard work and perseverance in order to be successful in life. Moreover, he wants to earn more so that he can send his children to school for better learning for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz is a farmer from Agsu. She is 56 years old and lives with her three children. Almaz is a widow. Her family is very close and they support one another. 

Almaz and her son run an agricultural business. They own a plot of land where they grow fruit and vegetables. They sell vegetables and fruit in nearby villages. Almaz requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and additional vegetables and fruit for sale. She has a good credit history and good morals. Her previous loan did her good, as through it she has gotten the economic resources she needed. She is certain that she will pay off the debt and at the same time give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Kiyomidin

texts.en:
You never see such wonderful grooming of hair as is made by Kiyomidin. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a kind woman who tries to help him however she can. They must comfort their children with all modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes his children more progressive. 

Kiyomidin tries to provide them with a better quality of life; that’s why, 15 years ago, he began his own business with barbering. He has his own workshop in the centre of his town. Thanks to the good service, he has managed to attract many customers. He wants to develop his business further but he needs to buy a new car to go to his clients' houses and serve clients who can’t come to his workshop. He promises to make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Mrs. Odgerel is 28 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in an apartment in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Idermunh, is 33 years old. Her daughter, Garamhand, is 1 year old. She stays at home. Odgerel has been worked in a local company and now she just started her retailing business at a rental counter in the clothes market with her husband. She is planning to increase the range of products she sells; she buys her products to offer. She is a hardworking and orderly person. She needs 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more goods for her business with the coming school year.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her business with the coming new school year

loans.name: Jenaime

texts.en:
Jenaime is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children, ages seven years old and ten months old. She lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her family and children. Jenaime has been running a sari-sari store or convenience store for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Jenaime works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Right now, Jenaime is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy  additional items to sell in her store such as noodles and other dry goods, snack foods and others. With this, she will be able to enhance her sales and eventually her profit.

Jenaime dreams of making her business a success. She has hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs, especially for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store such as noodles and other dry goods, snack foods and others

loans.name: Alawe

texts.en: Alawe used his previous loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents.  Today he is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of beverages and sugar and flour. This would allow him to have a stock of inventory, get discounts for quick payment, and offer products to his customers who have become accustomed to his best daily products every day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages and sugar and flour.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells yams in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Ama is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling yams for six years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees as her husband is responsible for other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy yams in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Leidi Ester

texts.es: Leidi en la actualidad ha aplicado a su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual ha incrementado su capital de trabajo y ha mejorado la cobertura de clientes pero con un nivel de exigencia superior, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una maquina plana y una rescubridora, con la cual mejorará la calidad del producto y será mas efectiva en el proceso, porque disminuirá los tiempos productivos. Su meta mas adelante es tener su taller provisto de todas las maquinarias y muchas operarias trabajando y respondiendo a una extensa clientela, por la que  diariamente Leidi hoy  se preocupa en incrementar.
texts.en: Leidi at this time has applied for her second loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will have increased her working capital and the customer coverage at a higher level of requirements. That is the reason she has turned to a new Kiva loan. With it, she will buy a flat bed sewing machine and a coverstitch machine. This way, she will improve the quality of her product and the process will be more effective, because she will shrink the production times. Her goal for the future is to have her workshop supplied with all of the machines and many operators working and responding to an extensive clientele. That is why Leidi is planning on growing.

loans.use: to buy a flat bed sewing machine  and a coverstitch machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells second-hand clothing and decorations (such as plastic flowers) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling second-hand clothing for three years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy clothing and other items in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as disposable plates and cups as well as sauces and more things that her business needs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Antonia; La socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura ,la socia lleva años dedicandose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia siembra papa y maiz para luego venderlo en los diferentes mercados de Cusco tambien algunos clientes van a buscarla a su casa para comprar su mercaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y abono para su chacra.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Antonia. She is still working as a farmer. She has done this activity for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business. She plants potatoes and corn to later sell in different markets in Cuzco. Some customers go to her house to buy her merchandise. She is a responsible and dedicated and really wants to continue working for her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops. She is grateful for the loan and sommitted to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Lucila; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cadia dia a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como mercados,la socia vende zanahorias,cebollas,zapallo entre otros,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de verduras al por mayor (zanahorias).
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The borrower Lucila continues with her business of buying and selling vegetables. She has had this business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to her determination in working in her business each day. She is a responsible and determined person with a strong desire to continue working for her family. She sells in a mobile manner to the areas where she sees the most customer demand such as markets. She sells carrots, onions and pumpkin as well as other vegetables. The borrower wants to continue working. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables wholesale (carrots). The borrower is grateful for the loan and promises to make all of the repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale (carrots).

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Lucila;La socia continua dedicandose a la ganaderia ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia tiene vacas lecheras las cuales cria para luego venderlas en las ferias de los dias sabados,la socia tambien vende queso y leche ,a la vez continua dedicandose a la agricultura sembrando papa,maiz entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animales como forraje.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is Lucila. The member continues to make a living from livestock farming, she has spent years in this business which is doing well thanks to her commitment. 

The partner has dairy cows which she breeds and sells during the saturday´s fairs. She also sells cheese and milk. At the same time, she continues to make a living from agriculture; sowing potato and corn among others. The partner is a responsible person and tenacious, which has allowed her family to get ahead. 

The partner asks for the loan to purchase food for the animal, such as hay. The partner is grateful for the credit and promises to pay the loan payments in the established deadline.

loans.use: The partner asks for the loan to purchase food for the animal, such as hay

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya is 51 years old and lives with her husband and her two sons in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The area has no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity.  She works as a teller in the bank. One of her sons will move out from his parents' house soon and his family has been building a small winter house for him as a wedding gift. Work on the house is nearly 50 percent done, and the family plans to complete it next spring. 

Due to money shortages, however, the family is missing some building materials needed to complete the house. Mrs. Tuya and her husband are planning to build the house walls with insulation, in order to guard against the freezing cold by losing heat through the walls. It is very important to cut fuel usage such as coal in the winter. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In addition to this, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the main reasons for Mongolians' hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers green loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on natural gas.  The loan Mrs. Tuya is taking will be used to buy wall insulation materials for building her son's new family house.

loans.use: To buy wall insulation materials for building a new family house.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is 32 years old. She is a cheerful and very hard-working woman. She is married to 34 year old Rashid and the couple have four children. They live in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.

Sikukuu has been selling clothing for one and a half years. The good thing about her business is that she has a large number of customers who come to visit her knowing that they will find clothes to suit their tastes. Her business success lies in the good service she provides and the fact that she sells her merchandise at reasonable prices.

This is Sikukuu's first loan from Yehu and she feels happy to know that she will once again have financial support.  She will use her 20,000 KES loan to travel to the city of Mombasa to buy a wider range of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan and her spouse help each other to manage their rice farm and generate a decent income for their family. Chan has been a farmer for 27 years and  through this period has learned to improve her farming practices as well as the business. She wants to be a successful entrepreneur and aspires to provide her family with a better quality of life. Chan is now 45 years old and has two dependent children who still need her support.

As of now, Chan is requesting credit through HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides needed for her farm. She hopes that she will be able to maintain an abundant harvest this coming season because of the impact of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides needed for her farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a merchant from Bohol, Philippines. She is in the food vending business for more than ten years now and her husband is a fisherman. She has six grown up children.

Marina is in need of additional funds for her business. She is requesting a loan worth 9000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, candies, fruits and other products. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers or customers, thus giving her more of a chance to increase her sales and profit. 

Marina dreams of expanding her business. She believes that if she is provided with financial support through a loan, she will finally be able to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, candies, fruits and other products.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has seven children. She sells banku and accra kenkey, food staples eaten with many dishes in Ghana, in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for the past five years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. 

She will use the loan to purchase maize and cassava, which is what kenkey and banku are made from. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells fried and smoked fish in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Efua has been selling fried and smoked fish for five years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to then fry or smoke. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to then fry or smoke.

loans.name: Samban's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Samban is a 37-year-old married mother of one son and one daughter, both of who are dependent on her and are still in school. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income, which she and her husband have been in for twelve years in order to support the family. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

This is the sixth microloan for Samban with Kiva’s partner VisionFund while the other members in the group are just in the first cycle. Samban has successfully used the past loans to relieve her family’s burden in terms of expenditure and the benefits from these loans also helped to keep her children in school. 

Samban was appointed to be a leader to lead a group loan of three members, all of who are females. As the leader, she used her portion to spend on farmland preparation and also to buy fertilizers for her crops. Hopefully, it will produce good yield, which in return she can sell the products at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo de 60 años de edad es propietario de una tienda ubicada en el centro del municipio donde habita; allí ofrece al público ranchos, víveres, refrescos entre otros artículos de la canasta familiar al detalle y de contado. Su negocio inició desde hace 18 años en un espacio de su casa, ubicada muy cerca a la vía donde circulan los buses y a una institución educativa, que potencializa las ventas, especialmente de refrescos y ranchos, víveres y confitería en general. Su trabajo lo desempeña desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, porque es un hombre muy trabajador que quiere lograr metas de estabilidad empresarial  y bienestar familiar. El negocio de Adolfo tiene un potencial de crecimiento importante y requiere tener una oferta de productos exhibida permanentemente, así mismo requiere hacer adecuaciones a su local, con el fin de ofrecer una atención más confortable a su clientela. Pero su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para hacer esta inversión en mayor volumen y realizar el mejoramiento locativo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprara arroz, aceite, cereales y adecuará sus instalaciones, porque espera mejorar su presentación, aumentar el surtido diario con inventarios en stock e impactar sus ventas con el aumento de una clientela bien atendida, que cada vez que compra regresa y es fiel.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 60 years old and is the owner of a store located in the center of his town.  There, he offers the public food and soft drinks among other things from his selection of familiar items.  He started this business 18 years ago from a space in his home which is located very close to an intersection where a school is located and buses pass.  This location strengthens sales specifically that of soft drinks, food, and confectionery among others. 

He works from 6am to 10pm because he is a very hard worker that wants to accomplish his goals of entrepreneurial stability and the well being of his family.  Adolfo's business has strong growth potential and he requires a permanent product offering thus requiring the adaptation of his location with the goal of offering the most comfortable products to his customers. 
 
His greatest challenge, however, is not having enough working capital to invest in higher volumes and realizing the improvement of his locale.  This is the reason why he seeks a Kiva loan with which he will purchase rice, oil, and cereals to improve his business in the hopes of employing a marketable presentation.  He also hopes to increase the amount of inventory he has in stock and impact his sales by increasing the amount of customers served.  He hopes that every time they purchase they return and are faithful.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and cereal to improve his business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 53 years old and is married. She sells food and drinks, such as potatoes, bananas, beans, fanta, milk, etc. She has ten years of experience in this business, and she employs six people to help her. 

Aisha has requested a loan from Kiva in order to buy more food and drinks for resale. She will use any additional profits to reinvest in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to buy more food and drinks, such as potatoes, bananas, beans, fanta, milk, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay is a 34-year-old man from Agsu, Azerbaijan, who has four family members. Oqtay has worked in auto repair for five years. He buys and sells new and semi-new equipment. Oqtay applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, AqroInvest, in order to increase his stock of automobile oil and lubricants. This is his second loan, and his previous loan allowed Oqtay to generate a more stable income for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of automobile oil.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a shop owner who has a general store. She has been making her living running the store for more than five years. She is married and has one daughter. 

Fatuma is a very hardworking person who recently opened a clothes selling business. In addition to this, she established a poultry business to increase her income. She says that, thanks to her businesses, she can help her husband with the household expenses. Life is very difficult, and if they can meet their expenses together, it's much better. Fatuma says that her goal is to have several businesses to be able to continue helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase chicks, chicken feed and bundles of clothes. She gives her thanks for the opportunity she has been given with the loan; it's very important to her.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chicken feed and bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children who both attend school. She operates a clothes business, a business that she has been operating for three years. She also earns income from her spouse.

Hamida learned about Yehu through a friend. She wants to access credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are seasonal weather and competition from other similar businesses. Hamida is applying for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy clothes for her business. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve the living standards of her life. She aspires to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 30 years old and from Gaza.

Alaa is married and has two children. He has owned an auto-repair shop since 2006 and also works as a tinsmith.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a compressor and install a big umbrella to protect him from sun and rain.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and increase his customers.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and install a big umbrella to protect him from sun and rain.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a single mother of seven children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. She sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal at her home.  

Her major business challenges include the transportation of commodities from Kampala city shops to her shop, defaulters and thieves. She aspires to seeing her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked wholesale shop, and also to build her own business premises.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en:
Ziya is a married man of 38 and a father of two children. Ziya opened his own mini-market in 2006. He knows very well how to select his products and serve his customers the best he can. 

This is his second loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. Ziya has a good credit history and good morals. 

Today, he requested a new loan from Kiva and Aqroinvest in amount of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). He plans to buy more goods and provisions for his business, such as sugar, soft drinks, dairy products and many other items.

loans.use: to buy more goods and provisions.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario tiene 26 años se dedica a la venta de desayunos, ella es una persona que ha aprendido la actividad de su madre que trabajo en el mercado ramada por más de 20 años, ella le enseño el oficio,  La Sra. Rosario cuenta con puesto propio y vende desayunos todo el día. Los productos que ofrece son te, café, api y empanada, la Sra. Rosario cuenta con 4 hijos ella es madre soltera, por cosas del destino, pero ella es valiente y trabaja duro para sacar a sus hijos adelante,  Tres hijos estudian en la escuela y uno es menor de edad. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de vajilla e insumos como azúcar y café para la elaboración de sus desayunos,  Su aspiración es tener su propia movilidad para poder trasladar su mercadería y su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y convertirse en personas de bien.
texts.en: Rosario, 26, sells breakfasts. She learned the trade from her mother who worked in the Ramada market for more than 20 years and taught her how to do it. Rosario has her own stall and sells breakfasts all day long. She offers tea, coffee, api [a non-alcoholic corn drink] and empanadas. As fate would have it, Rosario is a single mother of four children, but she is brave and works hard to get her children ahead. Three of them are studying in school and one is not yet old enough. She asks for a loan to buy dishes and ingredients like sugar and coffee to make her breakfasts. Her goal is to have a vehicle to move her merchandise and she hopes to see her children become professionals and upstanding people.

loans.use: to buy dishes and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, beans and snacks.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa tiene 38 años es agricultora, nacida en Chuquisaca con cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, casada con don Isaac, ella vive en Tiquipaya municipio de el Torno y trabaja junto a su esposo y sus hijos, todo lo que ellos siembran como ser zanahoria y otras verduras, ello lo sacan a vender directamente al consumidor en los mercados de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de zanahorias y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, ya que el anterior crédito invirtió también en la siembra de zanahoria y le fue muy bien por este motivo desea poder invertir en lo mismo está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Elsa, 38, is a farmer. She was born in Chuquisaca and has four school-aged children. She is married to Isaac and they live in the town of Tiquipaya in the county of Torno. She works alongside her husband and children, all of whom plant carrots and other vegetables. She harvests them and sells them directly to consumers in the markets in Santa Cruz.

The loan will be used for sowing carrots, which involves preparing the land for the planting. She invested her previous loan in planting carrots and it went very well so she wants to invest in the same thing. She is very grateful to the institution for the economic support they have provided.

loans.use: to prepare the soil to plant carrots.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from five to eighteen years. She describes herself as a faithful woman. She operates a posho mill retail store where she sells maize and provides the service of grinding the maize. She has been involved in this business for eighteen years. Her business is located on agricultural land, and her primary customers are poor. She describes her biggest business challenge as poor infrastructure within the area, leading to poor accessibility. She will use the loan of 8,700 KES to buy a water tank for her family and household use. Her business goal is to be a large-scale producer of maize within five years. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Julia also runs a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nyedo in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past one year, Kevin has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale, and will help Kevin to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Kevin hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business and buy beds for the patients. 

Kevin is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 34 years old and single. She has three children whom she loves greatly. Francisca is the owner of a small store. She started the store more than five years ago from her savings. Gradually, she began building the business, and it now supports her family.

Francisca requested this loan to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables, because there is very good customer demand for the products she sells. Her wish is that the business will continue to prosper as it is doing now so that it will provide the family with a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Beja

texts.en:
Beja hails from the village of Mwambalazi. He is 67 years old and is married with eight children. He has four grown-up children, while four still attend school. He is an entrepreneurial man who works in the community, where he raises goats for meat sale.

Today, the majority of his children are now professional people. He is a strong-spirited, hardworking man who has spent his life working hard to provide the best that he can for his family.

He is applying for this loan to buy livestock to raise so that he can continue working and helping his family. He is very happy with the support provided by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy goats for meat sale

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be a self-motivated man. 

He operates a welding retail store where he sells windows and doors. He has been involved in this business for 13 years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a competitive shopping area, and his primary customers are farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of the metal used for welding doors and windows. 

He will use the 15,600 Kenyan shillings (Kes) loan to buy a water tank for his family's use. His business goal is to expand his business into a big welding industry within five years. Protus also does farming, which increases his daily income. He has already received a loan of Kes 50,000, which he managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank worth 15,600 Kenyan shillings.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 42 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Coast Province, Kenya.

She has been selling cashew nuts for more than eight years, earning approximately Ksh 300 daily. Her husband is a businessman. All of her children are in school.

Fatuma is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man from the village of Mwambalazi, Kenya. He drives a motorcycle taxi, and has worked as a taxi driver for ten years. He started his business thinking of his own progress and that of his family.

He remarks that his job is very difficult, and during the rainy season it is more difficult since he has fewer passengers because it is cold. His dream is to buy more motorcycles to work, and thus progress on every day.

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
This is Mwanasiti, age 49, who is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a mother to five children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Mwanasiti operates a mat retailing business. She buys them at the market and sells them door to door. Customers are attracted to her business due to her low selling prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members.

To help her continue operating her business, Mwanasiti is requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more mats to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mwanasiti dreams of having a good future. Her hope is that her children will finish their education through all her hard work on her business.

loans.use: to buy more mats to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with eight children; seven of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (nephews). 

She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for ten years. She generates additional income through renting rooms.  

She has applied for a loan of 2000000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bread, bags of sugar, jerrycans of cooking oil, cartons of salt, bags of rice and maize flour. She sells these products in her shop to all types of people, and seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include debtors and transportation of commodities from Kikuubo to her shop. She aspires of owning a delivery van to help with transportation and to own a wholesale shop. 

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bread, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil, bags of rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza buys and sells products brought from Mombasa town. She is a widow and has four children. They are all grown ups that help in the business.

She is a very hard-working person. She has had a grocery store for over six years. Through her hard work she has been able to give her children everything they need to have a life without the deprivations or limitations that she had to experience.

She is requesting the loan to buy packets of milk for resale. This way she will be able to continue growing, and soon she will be a great small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy packets of milk for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. 

She describes herself to be a diligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as soda, water, charcoal etc. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. Her business is located within a busy area and her primary customers are daily customers and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for family and her household chores. 

Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run the best supermarket in her home area. 

Alice also keeps poultry. She has previously received a loan of Kes 20,000 which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 27, is the proprietor of a store selling food and general household articles. It is located in a town in Mwambalazi. She started the business three years ago. 

Josephine’s main customers are neighbors in the area, especially housewives who daily find in the store an opportunity to purchase household products in an amount that is within their economic means. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy supplies and food in greater volume so that she will get discounts that will translate into new profits. And that is exactly what will make her Kiva loan a successful investment. Also, with this investment she will improve the financial possibilities of a successful introduction to the market so that her business will grow and be sustained.

loans.use: to buy supplies, food.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 32 years old and lives with her life partner in the coastal region of Kenya. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She sells cashew nuts at the market. She has been in this business for the last three years. Her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. She wants to buy more products in order to increase the business income as well as profit. She needs 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She is a laborious and creative woman.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high school. 

Ama sells gari and sugar, collects and resells soda bottles, and has recently also become a fishmonger in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Her husband is a driver. Ama uses her income for taking care of her young child. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase fish, sugar, and gari in bulk to resell. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, sugar, and gari in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and boxes of soap.  She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She sells to all categories of people but on retail.  She works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, rice cooking oil and boxes of soap

loans.name: Bena's Group

texts.en:
Bena's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Bena is eighteen years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. Bena has been working hard to manage her small market which sells types of food like matooke (steamed green plantain) and sweet potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food, like matooke, to resell and will help Bena to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food, like matooke, to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 48 years old and lives in Tskaltubo district. She has two children: 24-year-old Teona and 21-year-old Revaz. They help Marina to run the family agricultural business. In particular, the family has a greenhouse where during the winter season the family grows greens, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Marina sells her production at the local open market. They sell greens locally and then this production is sent abroad as an export. The family works hard but they still don’t have enough income to expand their business. The total average monthly income of the family 550 Laris.

Marina requested a loan to repair her greenhouse because it is in bad conditions. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials. After the greenhouse is repaired, Marina will plant more vegetables and the income of the family will significantly increase. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouse

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard, aged 50, owns a store in Mwambalazi. He lives there with his wife and five children. 

He started his business four years ago from his savings. He has grown the business since then, and his income from it helps to support his family. He stocks all the everyday products that people in his neighborhood want. He listens to his customers and stocks new products when he can. That's where Kiva comes in: Bernard wants to stock new products for his store and needs this Yehu Microfinance Trust loan to fund the investment. He will buy foodstuffs, kitchenware and other products that his customers have asked him to sell, especially during the season of Ramadhan- Muslim's fasting holy month. Your loan will allow him to keep his customers, and also provide his neighborhood with a store nearby that they can easily come to. 

Bernard is a hard-working man. He starts his day at 6 in the morning and often works 12 hours a day, Monday to Sunday. He is confident that all his hard work will pay off one day.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, kitchenware and other products.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a very hard worker who is dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and five children in the district of Msambweni. She has been running her cashew nuts selling business for over 5 years.

Mwanasiti will invest this loan to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts. This way she will increase sales. She also hopes to better serve her customers. She hopes to increase revenues thus giving her a higher quality of life. Her dream is to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is forty one years old and married. She has three children with all of them attending school. Before coming to the current location, a little town in the central eastern part of Albania, her family resided in a very rural area where they experienced difficulties in almost every aspect of living.
For the past twelve years or so, Bukurije has been selling dairy to the local market. Throughout the years she has been able to establish a good clientele thanks to her personable nature, attitude towards work and care for animals. She wants to expand her business and buy five more milk cows, yet the loan she is requesting now is for something else, to stock up on fodder for the animals. At the same time her oldest son has been accepted to university and she needs to pay the tuition fees for him as well. 
Bukurije finds herself struggling at the moment, because she doesn’t have saved money for any of the obligations; yet, she believes that if she was given the loan for the purpose requested, the stress that it was causing her lately, would ease up the way she feels.

loans.use: To stock up on fodder for animals

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: L a présidente Chizigire est une femme dynamique du groupe de credit ujamaa. Mariée  à un mécanicien,  mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés  est vendeuse des souliers au marché central de Bukavu depuis 1994.  Le credit sollicité va lui faciliter l’approvisionnement en 4 cartons de douze paires de souliers usagers.  Son vouloir est de devenir grossiste ; ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien au femme à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Chizigire is the dynamic leader of the Ujamaa credit group.  She is married to a mechanic, the mother of nine children who all go to school, and she has been selling shoes at the central market in Bukavu since 1994.

The loan requested will help her to get four boxes containing 12 pairs of used shoes.  She would like to become a wholesaler.

She thanks Hekima for its support toward low-income women.

loans.use: to buy four boxes containing 12 pairs of used shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire est une femme entrepreneur  d’une association d’affaire Ufunuo. Elle est âgée de 44ans, mariée à un homme d’affaire est  mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse de viande depuis  1990.  Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 120kgs de viande.  La cliente rêve construire une maison d’habitation et avoir sa propre boucherie. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
This client, Nsimire, is an entrepreneur who belongs to the Ufunuo business group.  She is 44 years old, married to a business man and the mother of nine children who all attend school.

She has been selling meat since 1990.

The requested loan will help her to purchase 120 kg of meat.

Nsimire's dream is to build a house and to have her own butcher shop.

She thanks Hekima and prays to God to bless this organization.

loans.use: to buy 120 kg of meat.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es:
Silvia, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada, tiene un niño de siete meses en casa propia, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz junto con su esposo, de este trabajo han logrado salir adelante, llevan dos años de estar realizandolo.

Ella comprará cinco sacos de abono dentro de los cuales serán tres de sulfato y dos de formula, para esto solicita un préstamo que le brinde los recursos para solventar las necesidades de materiales, gracias al crédito están aplicando los materiales necesarios a obtener una buena producción.

Su objetivo es poder mejorar económicamente al lado de su esposo y de su hijo, tener una condición de vida más digna junto a ellos a través del trabajo que realizan.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 21-year-old married mother of a 7-month-old son. She and her husband own a home and work cultivating corn. They have been in this line of work for two years and have been able to get ahead because of it.

She will purchase five sacks of fertilizer, of which three will be sulphate and two will be complete inorganic fertilizer. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will help her get the funds she needs to pay for her material necessities. Thanks to loans, they are applying the materials needed to yield a good harvest.

Her goal is to be able to improve her family's financial status and have more decent living conditions thanks to their work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stocks of goods (rice, cans of refined oil etc...)

loans.name: German

texts.es: El  Sr. Germán tiene 49 es viudo, su esposa falleció hace bastante tiempo cuenta que fue un golpe duro para el ya que se encargo solo de sus tres hijos que son de las edades de 10, 16 y 14 años, el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales y frutas como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Santa Rita,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Germán va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de sandia y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  el Sr. Germán  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara su  calidad de vida  ya que mantiene con esta actividad a toda su familia, El Sr.  Germán es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. German is a 49-year-old widower whose wife passed away some time ago. He states that it was a hard blow for him as he had to raise his three children ages 10, 14, and 16 by himself. He works in agriculture, growing a variety of fruits and vegetables, as well as potatoes and cassava, on his crop field in the community of Santa Rita. This is his first loan with the institution. Mr. German will use this loan in order to prepare his land for watermelon cultivation. He needs this loan in order to obtain the materials necessary for sewing and maintaining his crops. Mr. German faces challenges, such as inclement weather, which has ruined his sown fields on several occasions. He will use his profits to improve his quality of life since he supports his entire family with this business. Mr. German is a responsible and hardworking person who is thankful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to start watermelon cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cold meats, vegetables, meats, chicken, breads, cooking oil, and seasoning.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, 38, is married and lives with her husband, Irakli. Ekaterine and Irakli run their own agricultural business. In particular, they have a milking cow and two pigs. Ekaterine milks the cow every day and produces cheese. The family also owns two greenhouses where tomatoes, greens and maize are grown. They sell vegetables, cheese and piglets at the local market. Irakli has a farm tractor and cultivates plot lands. Ekaterine and Irakli are very hard-working but they still don’t have enough income to make some savings to expand their business.

Ekaterine requested a loan to repair the greenhouse because it is old and damaged. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials. After the greenhouse is repaired, Ekaterine will plant more vegetables there and will sell the harvested product for a good price. With this, the income of the family will significantly increase and both members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouse.

loans.name: Mdune

texts.en:
Mdune, 28, lives in Mwambalazi, a town located near Msambweni district, with his four children, all of whom attend school. There, he raises goats for meat, which he sells to customers in his town. He began his business of selling goats for meat when he learned from a relative, who was buying goats for sale, how this business worked. 

Mdune began with a few customers and today supplies stores, granaries, and the community in general. His goal is to expand his business and increase his working capital. This is why he has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan that he has obtained from Yehu Microfinance Trust, with which he will buy goats in neighboring towns, which offer him a good price to respond to his growing clientele.

At this time his business has the financial indicator of return on sales of no less than 11% and with his investment he plans to make this grow. His dream is to be able to support the professional education of his four children, so that in the future they will be successful professionals who are useful to society.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha lives with her husband and her six children, who all attend the local school. With a secondary school education, she specialized in the sale of groceries in a grocery store a few years ago. She stocks up at one of the markets in Kenya.

Striving to satisfy her clients' strong demand, which is growing daily thanks to the strategic location of her store, she already established a strong customer base. She is asking for a loan so as to increase her inventory. With the loan, she plans to purchase fruits and vegetables. The profits will allow her to help pay for her children's schooling and ensure that they receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Karen Nohemy

texts.es:
Karen, vive con su esposo y un hijo, se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio lo organizó por iniciativa propia para trabajar desde su casa, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, entre otros productos que son necesarios en el diario vivir de los clientes, este préstamo le permitirá realizar una buena impresión y crecer en el negocio, permitiéndose generar mejores ganancias ya que permanecerá surtido.

Su aspiración es a futuro poder tener un mayor número de clientes, como un negocio fuertemente en variedad de mercadería, también invertir en el desarrollo de su hijo.
texts.en:
Karen lives with her husband and son.  She runs a grocery store, which she started on her own initiative so as to work from home.  She does not have fixed opening hours.
 
She is seeking a loan to buy basic goods, such as rice, beans, oil, and eggs, all of which her clients need for their day-to-day lives.  The loan will mean that she can make a good impression on her customers and continue to grow her business, allowing her to generate better profits and remain well-stocked.

Her goal for the future is to have a larger number of clients as a business with a wide variety of merchandise.  She also wants to invest in her son's development.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Aurid
