texts.es: Aurid trabajó durante 25 años en una empresa que fue liquidada  y  para continuar activa generando ingresos,  emprendió su propia aventura de negocio hace 1 año. Ella tiene una miscelánea, donde vende artículos varios, como accesorios femeninos, papelería, ropa, artículos para el hogar y detalles para regalos. Su clientela la conforman principalmente amas de casa y jóvenes, que encuentran en el negocio de Aurid muchos productos que llaman su atención, porque ella conoce bien las necesidades y gustos de su clientela y organiza sus instalaciones de manera atractiva para atraerlos, actualizando su estantería en cada temporada con ofertas de artículos ajustados a la demanda del mercado.  Su meta es continuar creciendo y consolidándose en el mercado, por eso realiza sus ventas  bajo las modalidades de crédito y de contado y de acuerdo a las posibilidades de cada cliente. Ella todos los días abre al público desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, porque su meta principal es continuar aportándole al bienestar de su familia, pues en condiciones de viuda y de madre de 2 jóvenes, sueña con verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestuario, electrodomésticos menores, accesorios, calzado, que son las mercancías de mayor rotación en la temporada que se acerca y sus clientes la han solicitado y con las cuales aspira a aumentar sus ingresos y continuar su crecimiento paulatinamente.
texts.en:
Aurid worked for 25 years in a company that went bankrupt, and to keep generating income, she began her own journey with a business she opened a year ago. She has a variety shop, where she sells all kinds of goods, such as women's accessories, paper, clothing, household items and things for gifts.  Her clientele is mainly housewives and young people, who find products that strike their attention in her shop because she has a good idea of their needs and taste and organizes her displays in an attractive way to draw them in.  She updates her windows for every season with offers on goods that are adjusted to market demand.

Her goal is to keep growing and to consolidate her place in the market.  For this reason, she sells things on credit and in installments and according to each client's needs.  She is open every day from 7 am to 10 pm because her main goal is to continue looking after her family's well-being, since she is a widow and mother of two, and she wants to see her children become successful professionals.  

At the moment, she is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy clothing, small appliances, accessories, and shoes, which is the merchandise with the best turnover in the coming season and which her clients are requesting.  With these, she hopes to increase her income and continue growing little by little.

loans.use: to buy clothing, small appliances, accessories, and footwear.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 57 years old. She is a widow who lives alone in the Terjola district. She has had to deal with great difficulties throughout her life, but her determination to get ahead has always allowed her to overcome them. 

She earns her living dairy farming, with three milking cows from which she produces and sells cheese. Gulnara owns five calves as well. She is a very hard-working woman and takes good care of her livestock. She also works on a poultry farm and gets a monthly salary. Gulnara works hard but still doesn’t have enough income to save and improve her living conditions. Her total average monthly income is 200 Gel, which is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses.

Gulnara has requested a loan to repair her house, which is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and after repairing the house she will be able to change her living conditions and spend her evenings, after a hard day of work, in a more comfortable environment. Gulnara hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 46 years old and lives in Mwambalazi with his wife. He has eight children, all of whom attend school. David's business is raising goats to sell for their meat. He started his business in 1999 when, with a small amount of capital, he started raising these animals in his yard, fattening them and selling them. He is supported in this business by his wife.

David's business has gradually grown and now his main customers are not only housewives but also restaurants and businesses that sell special meals. This helps his business, as they always refer new buyers to him. David's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy goats. For this reason, he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more goats. This will help increase his income, which his family depends on.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 49 years old and lives in the Tkibuli district with her large family of seven. She has a husband, a father-in-law and four sons (16, 22, 26 and 27 years old). The youngest son goes to the local school. The 26-year-old son, Eristo, works at a petrol station in the Tkibuli District and gets a monthly salary. Lali’s father-in-law is a pensioner. Her husband works as a security guard in the village school and gets a monthly salary too. 

The family's main source of income is their dairy farm. They have two milking cows and pigs. Lali milks the cows every day and produces cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family, and the rest is sold locally. The family sells piglets in the nearby villages. Along with the livestock, the family owns a vineyard in which they work hard to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in late summer and sell them to local farmers. Although the family works hard, they still don’t have enough income to save and improve their living conditions. Their total average monthly income is 1,000 Laris.

Lali has requested a loan to repair her house, which is very old and damaged. With this loan Lali’s dream will be fulfilled, and she will be able to renovate the house. Thus the family will be able to spend their evenings after their hard-working days in a more comfortable environment. Her loan will ensure better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 30-year-old Egyptian woman from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities in central Albania. She is married and has two children, nine and eleven years old, who, despite their ages, do not attend school. Many Egyptian children here do not receive an education for various reasons.

Silvana has been selling used clothes, home appliances, shoes, etc. for 15 years, at first with her mother and now on her own. “The profit has been just enough,” she says, “only to live a very basic and simple life.” Her dream is that someday she will be able to earn more money and improve the lives of her children, yet this still seems vague for the moment, she says.

Silvana is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more used items. She hopes that lenders will understand her circumstances and lend to her. She is responsible, and she gives her promise to every potential lender that she will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes, shoes, electrical home appliances...

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 39 years old and lives in a small village in the Tkibuli district. She lives with her father and two sons, who are 20 and 22 years old. Lia’s father is a pensioner. Both of her sons are unemployed. Lia earns her living through a dairy farm with two milking cows from which she produces cheese, curds and yogurt. Part of the dairy products are used by the family, and the rest is sold locally. The family owns pigs as well and sells them in nearby villages.  

Lia works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to save to improve the family’s living conditions. Their total average monthly income is 350 Laris. 

Lia has requested a loan to repair her house, which is very old and damaged. Thus she will be able to improve the living conditions of the family and spend evenings in a more comfortable environment. Lia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pick-up of wood.

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr: Alima est une femme de 39 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 23 ans qui va à l'école. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite boutique qu'elle dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans. C'est grace à cette activté qu'elle s'occupe de sa petite famille. Ses relations de bon voisinnage, son acceuil lui  permis d'agrandir sa clientèle au fil du temps. Elle a juste un problème dû à son capital qui n'est pas assez important pour augmenter les stocks de marchandises dans sa boutique et éviter les petites ruptures de stocks d'où la necessité de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter  les produits de premières necessité(carton de tomate en boites, savons, spaghetti, sacs de riz et de sel. Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénefices pour agrandir son activté le resta lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Alima is a 39-year old single woman and mother of one 23-year old child who attends school.  She is a merchant and for two years, she has had a small store in a neighborhood of the capital city.  Thanks to this business, she takes care of her small family.  Her good neighborly relations and her warm welcome enables her to grow her clientele over time.  She just has the problem of her business capital not being large enough to increase the inventory of merchandise in the store to avoid shortages.  This loan will enable her to buy the staples (cartons of tomatoes, soaps, spaghetti, bags of rice and salt) that she sells.  She will reinvest a part of her profits to grow her business and the rest will allow her to take care of her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy staples (cartons of tomatoes, soaps, spaghetti, bags of rice and salt)

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 35 years old and married without children. Her husband is privately employed and they own their house. For the past year, Doris has been selling charcoal at the market in order to help with the family expenses. She also works as a farmer. Doris has been a member of Yehu for three years.

Doris is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to restock her business. Her goal is to open a charcoal depot in future. She give thanks for this opportunity to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 49 years old and lives in a small village of Terjola district with his mother, who is a pensioner. He is a former soldier who fought in Apkhazeti and now receives a pension from the local government. Guram is a farmer who cultivates a plot of land where he grows various greens and maize. He works hard to ensure good harvests and sells his produce in nearby villages. Guram is very hardworking, but he still doesn’t have enough income to save and expand his business. The total average monthly income of his family is 290 GEL.

Guram is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and repair the fence at his house which is old and damaged. He will continue to work hard and cultivate greens an maize to sell at a good price. With his increased profit, Guram will be able to reinvest in his family agricultural business and expand it to make it more profitable. This will improve the living conditions of  his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and repair his fence

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla has a business where he sells goat meat. He started four years ago with very little capital, but with God's help and his family's efforts, he has managed to get his family ahead and more competitive every day. Abdalla's business goal is to continue expanding his business. His client base is increasing but he does not have enough capital to respond to the demand. Therefore, Abdalla has come to Yehu Microfinance for his third loan. 

Abdalla is requesting a loan to food supplies in large quantities for the Ramadan celebration -- the Muslim holy month of fasting. Abdalla thinks this investment will be successful because he will have products to offer to his growing number of customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and hopes to concentrate on strengthening his production to finally fulfill a dream that he shares with his wife: to see their five children grow up in conditions which foster their professional success.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, paint, glue and other materials to make new designs.

loans.name: Mjeni`

texts.en:
Mjeni is a hardworking woman living in Mombasa, Kenya. For the past year, she has owned a retail shop where she sells cereals. Her business challenges include inadequate capital to meet her high demand. Mjeni wishes to expand her business into new markets.

Mjeni is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of maize to sell. She wishes to open another shop in the future and her loan will allow her to continue to offer good services to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank for his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra.  Virginia  tiene 45 años con un hijo s de la edad de 17 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Cabeza Municipio El Torno,  preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una empleada quien le ayuda a preparar y también atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra de un frízer para lograr mantener una despensa llena y fresca,  la Sra. Virginia es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Señora Virginia is 45 and has one son, age 17.  She makes a living selling food, an activity that she does every day.  She carries out her sales in the town of Cabeza Municipio El Torno where she prepares and offers her customers a variety of dishes.  This activity is the main source of income for her and her family, and is carried out with an employee who helps with the preparation and also tends to the customers.  

The loan will be used to buy a freezer in order to maintain a full and fresh pantry.  Señora Virginia is a very hard-working person who has spent many years in this work of selling food.  She is very grateful to the institution for the help they offer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz tiene 49 años, se describe como una mujer trabajadora, muy alegre y con muchos deseos de superación. Luz vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en las afueras de la ciudad de Ibarra.

Luz trabaja sola en la venta de fritada, que es la carne de cerdo frita acompañada de mote, arbeja, papas, tostado. Luz también trabaja en la crianza de cerdos que es muy importante para la venta de la fritada. En vista que su negocio cada día crece más Luz decide realizar un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de maiz, mote, arbeja, papas  y para la compra de crias de cerdo, negocio que le ayudará a obtener mayor producción de los alimentos que vende y mejores ingresos para su familia.

Luz sueña que sus ingresos sean mayores para poder arrendar un local donde pueda acojer a más clientes y brindarles un buen servicio y con esas ganancias poder reconstruir su casa por que está detereorada.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old. She is described as a hardworking woman who is very cheerful and really wants to get ahead. Luz lives with her husband and her four children outside the city of Ibarra.

Luz works alone selling fritada. This is fried pork accompanied by hominy, peas, potatoes and toasted corn. Luz also works raising pigs, which is very important for selling fritada. Seeing that her business is growing every day, Luz has decided to take out a Fodemi loan, which will be invested in buying corn, hominy, peas and potatoes as well as to buy piglets. This will help her obtain better production of the food she sells and better income for her family. 

Luz dreams of her income being higher to be able to rent a locale where she can get more customers and offer them a good service and with those earnings be able to rebuild her house, because it has deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy corn, hominy, peas, and potatoes as well as piglets, because she also raises animals.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is an industrious woman who has been diligently working in her retail shop. She says that her business has been doing well and that her inventory has gone down. Mwaka is therefore asking for her second loan, in the amount of KES 35,000, to restock her shop. With this loan, she will be able to purchase sugar and bales of maize and wheat flour. Thanks for her efforts, her children are also doing well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and bales of maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.en:
Jacobo will use his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to save money and get along better with his neighbors. He’s a hog farmer who lives in an urbanized zone right next to the main church in his county. With his biodigestor, he will treat his pig waste, reducing or eliminating the odor and flies he and his neighbors currently deal with.
 
More importantly, he will dramatically reduce the amount of liquefied petroleum used to cook for the two families living in his home. By taking advantage of the biogas produced by his biodigester, Jacobo will save money and reduce his impact on the environment. He will also save money on fertilizer by using the organic fertilizer produced by his system.
 
This Kiva loan will help pay 80% of the system price.

loans.use: To purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
This is Josie, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a seaman, and mother to her three children. Together with her children, Josie manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  Josie operates an office supplies store.  People usually buy from her store since it’s cheaper than the office supplies inside the mall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Josie earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

Josie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more office supplies and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Josie hopes to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partner who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and products for her business

loans.name: Chamanal Group

texts.es:
El chamanal está constituido por dos mujeres emprendedoras que buscan una mejor calidad de vida consiguiendo sus objetivos. La representante de este grupo es Ana quien se destaca por ser una mujer decidida, inteligente y muy responsable en sus actividades, en la fotografía Ana es la chica de pantalon rosado.

Ana trabaja con su compañera en la crianza de cuyes, negocio que les permite ayudar a cada una de sus familias y tener ingresos para su educación superior. Debido a la necesidad de incrementar su negocio realizan un crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que será invertido en la adecuación del galpón comprando jaulas, bebedores de agua, también utilizarán para conprar alimentación de sus cuyes. Negocio que le ayudará a tener mayor numero de cuyes y mejores ingresos lo cual podrá contratar personal.

Ana sueña en tener una empresa grande con muchos colaboradores y poder terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
El Chamanal is comprised of two enterprising women who are looking for a better quality of life and meeting their objectives.  Ana is the representative of this group.  She stands out for being a determined woman who is intelligent and very responsible in her business activities.  Ana is the girl in the pink pants in the photo.

Ana works with her colleague raising guinea pigs.  The business allows them to help each of their families and to have income for their higher education.   Because of the need to expand her business, she is taking a loan with Fodemi.  

She will use the loan to upgrade the guinea pig shed by purchasing cages and water bottles.  She will also use the loan for food for her guinea pigs.  This will help her have more guinea pigs and improved income.  Then she will be able to hire personnel.  

Ana dreams of having a large business with lots of associates.  She also dreams of being able to finish her higher education.

loans.use: to upgrade the guinea pig shed and to buy food for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jaida Johana

texts.es:
la señora Jaida Johana esta casada, tiene 37 años de edad, esta gradada como secretaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la compra y venta de joyas de oro, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su mamá y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de oro y poder mejorar sus ganancias cuando vuelva a vender, espera seguir mejorando y no muy lejano tenga una joyería, ya que actualmente tiene un negocio ambulante.
texts.en:
Ms. Jaida Johana is married and 37 years old. She has graduated as a secretary and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. She works buying and selling gold jewelry. She started this business thanks to her mother and so far she has 5 years experience.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy gold and be able to improve her earnings when she sells again. She hopes to be able to keep improving and in the near future have a jewelry store, since right now she sells as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy and sell gold jewelry.

loans.name: Rreshit

texts.en:
Rreshit is in his early fifties, married, and the father of a teenager. His family lives in the central-eastern part of Albania, in a little town that has been booming lately. Villagers from the rough terrain have opted for a better and more convenient life in this little town. Only a couple of years ago, this little town had only half of the residents it does today. Residents here find themselves always doing something related to building construction, whether they build, demolish, or sell building materials. 

Rreshit has always been the sole provider for his family. After an accident three years ago, he started selling lime, which is used for building construction. He is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase lime to sell. In the future, he plans to open a pit and produce the lime himself, in order to reduce costs and, of course, generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase lime for building construction

loans.name: Malofou

texts.en: Malofou is 54 years old and married with 8 children. She would like to start a small business, doing elei printing (making traditional hand-printed fabrics). In order to do this, Malofou needs a loan to buy more materials, paints, and brushes. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy more materials, paints, and brushes

loans.name: Hildergard

texts.en: Hildergard is a 54-year-old widow with 4 children. To earn a living, she makes and sells ice cakes and soft drinks in her community. She has 2 years of experience selling refreshments. Hildergard needs a loan to buy plastic cups, flavorings, sugar, and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Hildergard has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, flavorings, and plastic cups

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en: Mouena is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Mouena needs a loan to buy a sack of sugar, various flavorings, plastic cups, and containers. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Mouena has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, flavorings, and plastic cups

loans.name: Taimane

texts.en: Taimane is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She catches fish and sells them within her community to earn a living. She has been selling fish in the village for two years. Taimane needs a loan to buy a fishing net and other equipment. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. Taimane has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lures, and other fishing gear

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past three years, Lolita has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles, and other items. 

Lolita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 20 years old and married with a child. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. For the past five years, Jenelyn has owned and operated a farm where she plants and harvests rice and fruit to sell. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly and she recently joined GDMPC.

Jenelyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise
